author: {'steamid': '76561198025839453', 'num_games_owned': 733, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1699681185}
review:
First, I must say that it met 2 of my most important steam requirements: Cloud save and achievements. 
Achievements make me happy (that dopamine hit) but cloud saves are essential since I use 2 devices, often switching between them.

Now to the game. I love the voice over work for the main characters. For the supporting characters the voice over can feel a little off or just off putting. It's not often enough to make me feel irritated by it or like give up on the game but it is enough to notice. I think they did a good job casting their voice actors overall. 

Another thing I initially noticed and really liked were the graphics and flow of the tutorial. Normally the tutorial for me is just another thing I have to put up with to avoid ruining the "no hints" achievement or sometimes even a "go through the tutorial" achievement.  

Even though the story is quite predictable, it is a pretty fairy tale even with its grim parts. The hidden object scenes and puzzles were a bit easy (I did play in casual mode which may have affected the difficulty) with the exception of one puzzle: [spoiler] the pearl puzzle was a headache for me, very tedious. Later to find out there are strategies for these. [/spoiler] .

The game is quite entertaining overall and I almost binged the whole game in just one sitting. 

I definitely recommend this game and its predecessor as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022854959', 'num_games_owned': 794, 'num_reviews': 383, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1672278384}
review: Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan offers a captivating hidden object/puzzle/adventure experience, drawing inspiration from Hans Christian Andersen's "The Wild Swans." Set in a beautifully hand-painted world, the game introduces you as a renowned healer summoned to save a Queen accused of practicing dark magic. The gameplay is a mix of hidden object scenes and clever puzzles. The puzzles are overall well-crafted and offer a satisfying level of challenge. Additionally, you have the support of three charming companions, each with unique abilities. The inclusion of the hint system and map from the first Grim Legends game enhances the gameplay greatly. Visually, Grim Legends 2 is nothing short of breathtaking. It whisks you away to an enchanting world brimming with intricate details and vivid colors. The voice acting has noticeably improved and the music fits the magical atmosphere of the game wonderfully. Overall, Grim Legends 2 is a delightful journey filled with magic and mystery, making it a good choice for fans of hidden object adventures.

author: {'steamid': '76561198256240230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1690070440}
review:
[h1] Grim Legends 2: Song Of The Dark Swan [/h1]

This is the second game in the triology of Grim Legends. This game works as a stand alone game so it has no connection to the first game in this triology. Which works greatly cause then you get introduced to a different story based on other fairytales and folklore. They do have something in common though - they both start of with a kidnapping - it is an effective kickoff to the game cause it gives you a sense of danger and thrill, as well as it gives the protagonist(you) a clear motive for moving forward - maybe a bit of a common startoff - but if it works why change, I guess. 

In this story we get to follow the protagonist, a famous healer, on her way as she is summoned by the royals of the Eagle Kingdom to examine the queen as she is affected by a mysterious illness. The healer's quest takes a sudden turn when the infant prince gets taken by someone using magic. The queen is accused of both practicing magic and kidnapping her own child - and by the kingdoms law,  magic is a crime punishable by death. Suddenly the queens life, the destiny of the prince as well as the future of the kingdom is in your hands -  Are you ready to unravel the mystery?   

Warning:
- I just want to warn you that some will find this story to be a bit darker/sadder - I think this just brings out the beauty of the story but some of you might not think that. 

It's a great HOG/HOPA-game - if you enjoy the genre - I can almost garantee that you will like this game as well. 

[h1] Pros [/h1]
- Beautiful art scenes/background during play - It also has moving parts like rain, insects, vegetation and so on - it makes the scene come more to life /seem less static or like an powerpoint presentation
- Nice background music that contribute to gameplay and story/mood
- Nice cutscenes, and they are frequent through the game
- Map travel 
- Adequate voice actors (but not on the brothers of the princess, they sound weird/awkward)
- Variety in puzzles and games (a bit more diffucult then the first game in this triology)
- A little friend/helper during the adventure (bird, otter and a spirit)
- Good flow throughout the game/the story moves along nicely
- I thought most of the items collected made sense (maybe a few felt out of place/weird to use but lets be honest - is it really a HOG-game without that?!)
- collecting gold feathers through the story which gave you a cutscene about the past piece by piece. I find this to be quite effective as a way of storytelling since you get led on bit by bit instead of alot of infodropping in the beginning. It also makes it a bit more thrilling. 
- Based of a well known fairytale (makes it a bit predictable)
- Bonus chapter (with 2 points of view - almost like 2 extra chapters)
- stand alone game
- You can acchieve 100% steam acchievement by playing the game only once! 

[h1] Cons [/h1]
- A bit ironic that you play as a healer - but most people around you die
- No option between hidden object and domino (like in the first game)
- Bad voice actors on the younger brothers of the princess
- Nothing new, very standard HOG-game (not nececerly a bad thing)

I would definitly recommend this game to people who enjoy HOG/HOPA-games! It's enchanting vibes and compelling story(a bit predictable and a bit sad) makes up a quite good HOG-game! 

I hope this was helpfull!

Good luck and have fun! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198258399533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1681853370}
review:
After playing all three games in the series, Grim Legends 2 has the most interesting story but the most lacking content. Loosely based off the Swan Princess fairy tale, it revolves around rescuing a mute queen from execution and saving her family. I most admired the Black Swan and how he was portrayed, both as a person and as an animal. The twist in the story could be guessed early in game but easily overlooked. Even though it no longer had the fun Domino mini-game from the first Grim Legends, it did give you a variety of animal companions during your journey. However, I was disappointed when I finished the game. I expected the bonus stage to include post-game content. It ended up being a cute pre-game stage, showing a scene from the queen's life before she was crowned. 

All in all, although I enjoyed playing the game, I found the bonus stage lacking and wished there was more content following the queen's son after he's grown up. Perhaps a small story with the prince as a growing child, who listened to his mother and uncles' story of being under the curse and then visited their old house in the forest. It would've been more fun to be the prince in the bonus stage with the spirits. He could've represented the next generation of royalty, befriended the rock wall who loved the queen and made a connection with the spirits. There was a huge disconnect when the bonus stage started with the spirits and went back to the past. It needed a better connection to the main story than acting as a prequel. Although I wouldn't recommend getting Grim Legends 2 by itself, I would recommend getting it as part of the Grim Legends Collection bundle. It was still fun to play. Just look for the bundle when it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123916740', 'num_games_owned': 1997, 'num_reviews': 289, 'playtime_forever': 1442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1442, 'last_played': 1670726699}
review:
First, this HOG is based around a Hans Christian Anderson tale, just a bit more dark than the original tale. I did like the story in this game and I appreciated the more adult feel to it. The graphics are on par with Artifex Mundi games. The voice acting was okay, though the accents for the younger brothers' voices did not match the rest of the family's voices, so it was a bit distracting. The puzzles were decent and not confusing or overly hard to figure out. The HO scenes were also okay, though it did seem like a couple items were oddly named (such as "bottle" for a jug-like item in a scene with a few more similar items in the background). 

I didn't experience any issues with the main or bonus game. 

Overall, this was a decent HOG. If you're a fan of HOGs, then I definitely would give this one a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198207083779', 'num_games_owned': 1292, 'num_reviews': 851, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1661149974}
review:
Um well okay...  This game...  If you came from the first game...  Is slightly different...  It still has nice graphics/cinematics/music and game play, but...  They are literally making it GRIM TALES!  The first has a nice story with a good end... And a sexy bear... This one doesn't have a sexy bear and MANY, LIKE MANY people/animals DIE.  You can't see it, but you can see dead bodies...  Not overly real though, so it's okay...

The story is dark and depressing...  It made me too agitated to think about puzzles...  Which seemed to be twice or three times as hard as the first game...  Oh and they couldn't show death of children, so those are the ONLY ONES WHO ARE ALIVE...  Apart from very few others...  Sigh...

It's okay...  I just can't bring myself to do any bonus content...  Thanks anyway...!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045411242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 941, 'last_played': 1660449269}
review:
[u]Recommendation[/u]: This is a good, quick hidden-object adventure game; it is somewhat better than the first Grim Legends game.

[u]Critique[/u]: Like a lot of hidden object adventure games, this game is very linear. It's very satisfying to be able to progress so effortlessly. As in the first game, there is a side mini-game that you do not need to play to complete the game, but which adds a fair amount of interest. In this game, it's finding the "Healer's Sigils:" the Healer's Sigil is sort of a cross between the rod of Asclepius and a treble clef, and nearly every screen has one for you to find, in addition to everything you have to do on the screen to complete the story.

[u]Review[/u]: This game's story is largely inspired by the fairy tale of the Swan Princess. The mute Queen of the Eagle Kingdom has fallen ill after giving birth to her first child, so you, a Healer, are sent for to minister to her health. But a spell is cast, the baby is stolen, and the Queen is imprisoned on the accusation that she used Black Magic. The laws against Black Magic are very clear in the Eagle Kingdom: those guilty of Black Magic must be burned at the stake! The King doesn't believe that the Queen would harm their child, so he entreats you to find the real culprit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005693997', 'num_games_owned': 372, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 668, 'last_played': 1658719099}
review:
Artifex Mundi does it again with another satisfying point and click puzzle game!  I'm going to bullet point a few things about the game that I think are worth mentioning:

- This game came out in 2014 and I still think it's a pretty game.  No, it's not like a triple A game graphically, but in this genre these sort of vibrant, beautiful backgrounds and characters are a stand out and still hold up.

- The story is pretty predictable but still enjoyable!  You get a fairly standard fantasy tale, but it was never boring at any point

-  As I have mentioned in my Grim Legends 1 review, these games are not what I would call "Hidden Object" games.  I think that's a little misleading, because while there are hidden object games in this, it's just one of many types of puzzles.  I love hidden object puzzles, but I appreciate that there is a variety of different puzzles in this game of varying difficulties.

- You do not need to have played the first Grim Legends game to play this one, the story is not connected

- The bonus content is really cute.  Very short but an adorable little scenario that fits the fairytale theme of these games.

- This game is such a nice slice of casual, no-pressure fun.  Even on the most difficult setting, I did not find anything about this game to be punishing.  Some of the puzzles aren't terribly difficult but a few of them genuinely gave me a bit of a challenge, and I love that you get both ends of that spectrum in this game. 

- I beat both the main game and the bonus content in about 7-8 hours. Full price for this game is 9.99 - I personally think that is just a tiny bit too high, but snagging this at any kind of discount is worth it.  Better yet, if you see the whole collection on discount, grab it - these games are great!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028822565', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1658774840}

author: {'steamid': '76561198091451306', 'num_games_owned': 577, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1655011720}
review:
Si j'ai pu appr√©cier le premier opus de la s√©rie Grim Legends (The Forsaken Bride), il faut avouer que le deuxi√®me jeu m'a √©t√© bien plus agr√©able, notamment - et cela peut entrer en contradiction avec ce que j'avais pu dire lors de la pr√©c√©dente critique - gr√¢ce au sc√©nario. The Forsaken Bride poss√®de un sc√©nario int√©ressant, n√©anmoins je ne m'√©tais pas forc√©ment attard√© dessus car il ne me semblait pas d'une importance primaire dans un jeu "point and click" (j'avais m√™me pu d√©clarer que le sc√©nario, pour un jeu de cette trempe, pouvait se r√©v√©ler facultatif) mais ce n'est rien √† c√¥t√© de Song of the Dark Swan qui m'a r√©ellement intrigu√© ; ressenti subjectif plus que cons√©quent. Un peu plus Fantasy que son ain√©, mais gardant tout de m√™me de nombreuses traces de merveilleux (emprunt√©es aux contes populaires), que peut bien nous raconter ce jeu vid√©o ?

Le sc√©nario donc, tant "encens√©" dans mon introduction, est sympathique. Oui, c'est tout ! En vrai, c'est v√©ritablement l'aspect subjectif qui a √©t√© touch√© car, si l'on se penche un peu plus sur le sujet, force est de constater - oeuvre de Fantasy oblige - que le sc√©nario n'est gu√®re original dans la forme. Mais le fond apporte les changements n√©cessaires pour que l'on passe un bon moment. Il y a une forme de tension, de suspense que le premier opus (d'une s√©rie dont les titres semblent ind√©pendants entre eux, je tiens √† le souligner √† nouveau) n'avait pas su susciter aussi bien que celui-l√† : une histoire de mal√©diction touchant une famille royale, l'apparition de plusieurs cygnes √©tranges, de la magie interdite... Des √©l√©ments donc vus et revus, il va sans dire, mais au service d'une histoire qui parvient √† tenir en haleine. Mais bien √©videmment, l'histoire n'est pas le "v√©ritable" centre d'int√©r√™t des jeux "point and click", m√™me s'il est toujours bienvenu de ne pas uniquement avoir une suite de mini-jeux sans lien entre eux mais force est de constater et de saluer le fait que l'on est en face d'un divertissement narratif vraiment sympathique !

Concernant les personnages mis en avant, tout comme le premier jeu de la s√©rie d√©velopp√©e par Artifex Mundi, il ne faut pas s'attendre √† un travail approfondi sur les pens√©es, les caract√®res et la vie pass√©e des protagonistes que l'on rencontre tout au long de notre aventure. N√©anmoins, le minimum d√©ploy√© demeure agr√©able quant √† notre immersion, bien que certains traits - gros et clich√©s - n'emp√™chent absolument pas √† nos r√©flexions de joueur / passionn√© de Fantasy / bon sens d√®s les premi√®res minutes de jeu. Fort heureusement, les r√©v√©lations faites au fur et √† mesure permettent de garder focalis√©e notre attention. L√† o√π dans le premier jeu, il y avait v√©ritablement des interactions "pouss√©es" avec d'autres personnages, ici cela est plus timide : peu de personnages sont ainsi mis en avant cependant, le jeu se rattrape en quelque sorte en faisant d'animaux sauv√©s et apprivois√©s de v√©ritables personnages et compagnons. Ce n'est pas grand chose mais le tout demeure amusant.

Pour le c√¥t√© plus technique, il n'y a gu√®re de changements. La recette du premier jeu fonctionnant √† merveille, pourquoi vouloir sans priver dans une suite ? De ce fait, les mini-jeux - malgr√© une impression de d√©j√† vu qui peut s'installer entre les propositions des √©nigmes des deux jeux - sont agr√©ables, certains inventifs et bien pens√©s, les aides sont toujours pr√©sentes (except√©es si l'on se d√©cide √† affronter le jeu en difficult√© haute - ce qui n'est pas non plus un d√©fi irr√©alisable), on peut r√©colter des troph√©es nous offrant des r√©compenses hors jeu (des images, des peintures...), bref : un jeu qui ne d√©payse pas enti√®rement. Et si cela va de soi pour les c√¥t√©s positifs, les c√¥t√©s "n√©gatifs" sont √©galement de retour, notamment les actions √† r√©aliser avec certains objets trouv√©s qui ne vont pas forc√©ment de soi, sans compter les quelques passages qui peuvent laisser perplexe sans que l'on sache quoi faire de nos objets ; que faut-il assembler, avec quoi, sur quoi, o√π √ßa...

Pour les d√©cors et les paysages offerts, nous avons toujours cette patte artistique bienvenue : c'est beau √† croquer, les lieux sont vari√©s et les d√©cors richement d√©taill√©s.

Pour les musiques, sans √™tre transcendant au possible - et en m√™me temps, nous ne demandons pas cela √† un jeu de ce gabarit - nous avons des compositions plut√¥t mignonnes, calmes mais n√©anmoins rythm√©es.

En bref, Grim Legends 2 : Song of the Dark Swan est un jeu qui se rapproche en de nombreux point avec le premier opus The Forsaken Bride : gu√®re d'am√©liorations dans le sens o√π il n'y avait pas forc√©ment d'am√©liorations n√©cessaires √† apporter, une ambiance de jeu toujours aussi d√©licate, des √©nigmes int√©ressantes et une histoire un minimum appr√©ciable (dans le cas de ce jeu, compl√®tement appr√©ciable m√™me !). De ce fait, il va sans dire que, √† l'instar du premier jeu, je recommande celui-ci pour les m√™mes mentions √©voqu√©es dans la critique pr√©c√©dente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020225761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1638279923}
review:
Another great game from great serie. Stunning visuals, charming music and dramatic story immerse us in one more fairy adventure, full of mystic creatures, dark magic and beautiful landscapes. 

As always, we get a good variety of beautiful hidden object scenes, puzzles and minigames of different difficulty and of course - a small and cute bonus chapter about local fairy creatures.

People often use this serie as an example of high quality HOG and that's absolutely justified. Thus, if you are looking for  some great representatives of the hidden object genre - go no further. You are looking at it right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971284198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1645436414}
review:
Great game!
The Grim Legends series is different from a few other Artifex Mundi hidden object games as it's independent from one another... no continuity in story as I guess each is a different fairy tale.
But anyways, interesting story and similar mechanics to the first entry, a plus for me personally.
Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067712055', 'num_games_owned': 1065, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1645568197}
review:
as others have said, the second installment of the grim legends series doesn't quite live up to the standards established by the previous game - the art isn't as nice, and the voice acting needed much better direction (the raw talent shows, but it's like they used they didn't understand, or weren't correctly told about, the tone of the scenes they were acting for). and the HOG alternative isn't there anymore, so you must play through them. also, with you being some random doctor brought to help, there isn't anymore the emotional stake of rescuing a loved one, which makes the story not as engaging.

that said, on its own, the song of the dark swan still is one of the best HOG out there, the puzzles are nice, not at all repetitive in my opinion, the music is really good and the art direction does make everything look as if pulled from a fairy tale book, appropriate for the subject at matter. i can still recommend this one easily and i'm crossing my fingers for the third game to be better. i also liked the many animal companions helping you through the game, with the otter being the best one. runs perfectly out of the box in linux mint (20.3).

author: {'steamid': '76561198835430528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1639229305}
review:
An above average hidden object game that is partially animated and completely voice acted.

Compared to the previous entry, the graphics are a bit improved. Animations are more common and look better, although face animations can appear a bit clunky sometimes.
The underlying story is decent.
The difficulty of the minigames is not consistent; some are pretty easy while others might require several minutes to crack.
There is only one set of collectibles this time which is relatively easy to complete.

review:
Colorful hidden object puzzle game in good quality. Story is not related to the first Grim Legends.
You are a healer investigating story of the seven swans.

+ Collect Butterflies and Healer's Sigils
- Don't like split picture puzzles, where moving one part moves another part too

author: {'steamid': '76561199161487173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 965, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 645, 'last_played': 1662155895}
review:
With colorful and beautiful artworks, this second Grim Legends may 
seems easier than the first one of the series at the beginning. 

it will be more challenging as you progress in the game. 

Hidden objects and logic puzzles have a correct level of difficulty, 
and sometimes the game will really ask you patience and time. 

Overall a very good follow-up with a nice atmosphere and music. 

If you have enjoyed the first one, then do not hesitate to get this 
second episode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198845717264', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 196, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1631264765}
review: This is the second game in the Grim Legends series. Both games are based on fairy tales, but the stories are unrelated, so you don‚Äôt need to remember anything from the first game. Gameplay is pretty similar though, so if you liked the first game, then you‚Äôll probably like this one too. One big difference is that they took out the domino game. I didn‚Äôt like the domino game, so I‚Äôll go with a thumbs up. There are some achievements for pointless collectibles, but they aren‚Äôt that hard to spot and there is only one sigil in each location. The hard part is remembering if you searched a location or not, but if you search each new location when you first get there before you do anything else, then you should find them all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198956299818', 'num_games_owned': 2010, 'num_reviews': 727, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1628104256}
review:
This is a really fun and beautiful hidden puzzle game. This game has a full story and you will also unlock a second part of the game with a different story. 

The art style is really beautiful and the story is so interesting and captivating. 

You might have to complete the game more than once to unlock all the achievements, however it doesn't take long to unlock all the achievements.

Overall I think this is a really fun game for everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105077461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1625618428}
review:
On a game-play point; It's pretty good. Nothing really stood out as jarringly wrong. It never broke on me (which has been a problem I've had with these kind of game in the past). And the mechanics work fairly well. 

On a story-line point; I don't like how the oldest brother was treated. It left a bit of a sour note to the whole thing, for me. And also the 'children never die, EVER!' thing has always annoyed me a bit in games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974186847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1626137647}
review:
really pretty artwork and story, fairly average but still okay plot

what I want to talk about are the quality of life mechanics

first off: there are some respectably challenging puzzles (which is great) but if you would like, you can also skip them and enjoy the story without having to slog through them

also: it's a hidden object game that blends the HO into the quests in pretty smart ways, but also once you've completed an HO puzzle, you can go to a menu and replay just that puzzle itself 

the game also has different modes, so you can play through casually at first (like I did) but there's one lingering achievement where you HAVE to play it in expert mode 

anyway, love the artwork and the theme, it's set up really well to enjoy in a lot of ways. one of the best I've encountered in the genre

author: {'steamid': '76561198363324027', 'num_games_owned': 449, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 939, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 703, 'last_played': 1630882463}
review:
[h1]Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan[/h1]

[h2]RATING: 4.5 Okay[/h2]
[h3](„Å£Ôºæ‚ñøÔºæ)€∂üç∏üåïüåïüåïüåïüåóüç∫Ÿ©(Àò‚ó°Àò)[/h3]

(Ôºè^-^)Ôºè‚ô™‚òÜ Recommend this game‚òÜ‚ô™Ôºº(^Ôºê^Ôºº)

[h1](„Éé„Çú‚àá„Çú)„Ééüé• Story[/h1] 
[h2]The Exciting Adventures of a Heroic Healer![/h2]
[b]Silent Queen, Vanished Prince: A Healer's Unexpected Quest in Eagle Castle[/b]
Once upon a time, there was a famous healer who was invited to the Eagle Castle by the Eagle King. The king's wife had lost her ability to speak, and the healer was called upon to cure her. The healer examined the queen and asked her to rest before further examination. But when the healer tried to enter the queen's chamber again, something strange happened. The door suddenly closed, trapping the queen and the prince inside! As soon as the healer opened the door, she witnessed the Little Prince being kidnapped. The healer's mission takes a sudden turn from healing to becoming an investigator when her mother-in-law accuses the queen of practicing dark magic and throws her into a prison tower.
[b]A Race Against Time[/b]
The king, desperate to prove his wife's innocence, asks the healer to find a way to clear the queen's name. The healer finds themselves in the ruins of the Swan Kingdom with only one day to uncover the secret behind a curse that has befallen the rulers. Only then can they find the young heir to the throne and save the queen from execution.
[b]The Fate of Two Kingdoms[/b]
Will the healer be able to save the queen and prove her innocence? Can they rescue the Little Prince from the clutches of dark magic? The destiny of both kingdoms rests in the hands of the brave healer. Join them on this thrilling journey and see if they can overcome the challenges and save the day!

[b]A Bonus Story of Forest Spirits and a Dragon[/b]
In addition to the main quest, players will have the opportunity to experience a bonus story in this game. This captivating tale focuses on forest spirits aiming to defeat a dragon. Players can play as both the forest spirit and the young Queen from the main story. Although unrelated to the main plot, this bonus story is included in the game at no additional expense, which is a fantastic bonus.

[h1]üéÆGame Review[/h1]
[h3]The Visualsüì∏Œµ -(¬¥„ÉªÔΩÄ)[/h3]
The art in this game is incredibly breathtaking! The characters and settings are so well-designed, and I think the art in this game is even better than the first one. The colors are so diverse and create a magical fantasy atmosphere. The artwork really sets the mood for the story, which is something I really love. Even though there are a few animated scenes that I don't like, the breathtaking artworks make up for it.

[h3](‚óî‚Ä¢‚óî)‚ô™‚ô™‚ô™The Sound[/h3]
The voice acting in this game is not the best. Some of the voices just don't sound right and don't fit the scene. I find the voice acting for the little boys to be really unnatural and annoying. But, there is one saving grace - the Forest Spirits. They sound so cute and they match their designs perfectly.

[h3]üèÜUnlock Achievements·ïô(‚áÄ‚Ä∏‚Üº‚Ä∂)·ïó[/h3]
Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan is an exciting game on Steam with a total of 29 achievements. 14 of these achievements are related to the story and can be earned by completing the main game on expert difficulty and watching the first 10 cut scenes. There are also achievements for completing mini-games without skipping, collecting all sigils and butterflies, completing hidden object scenes without hints or misclicks, and interacting with certain items for the Scholar achievement. The bonus chapter has two unmissable story-related achievements.

[h3]‚ï≠( ÔΩ•„ÖÇÔΩ•)Ÿà )))üß©The Two Kinds of Puzzles[/h3]
This game has two types of puzzles. 
The first type involves searching for objects in hidden object scenes and using them on other items. The scenes are well-designed, but sometimes the objects are hidden too well. However, unlike in the previous game, you don't have to replay these puzzles. 
The second type of puzzle is more traditional and logic-based. It includes sliding and rotation puzzles, which can be repetitive and time-consuming when they appear frequently. On a positive note, the interactive storyboard puzzles are enjoyable and help advance the story.

[h3]‡¨ò(‚à©^o^)‚äÉ‚îÅ‚òÜ„ÇúSwap Your Feline Friend for a Wild Trio[/h3]
Check it out, guys! The game just dropped three rad new friends for you to hang with: a cool swallow, an awesome otter, and a magical forest spirit. Each companion has unique abilities to assist you in your puzzle-solving journey. The swallow can reach high places, acting like a flying ladder. The otter scares away animals that might impede your progress, acting as a furry bodyguard. The forest spirit can make plants grow, enabling the creation of bridges or pathways. Switching between these companions adds variety to the game and helps you overcome obstacles. However, their use is limited to specific points in the game, and they mainly serve as visual enhancements rather than altering gameplay significantly.

[h3](¬¥‚äôœâ‚äô`)‚ö† Theme Story Spoiler üé≠[/h3]
[spoiler]The game [i]Song of the Dark Swan[/i], I think got its name from the loading screen, which showed the Dark Swan as a bard in his human form. He is a major character in the game, along with the Peacock Lady. I want to share his story because I love the game logo and his role in the game.
[b]The Dark Swan's Background[/b]
The Dark Swan was once the eldest prince in the Swan Kingdom, but a curse turned him and his brothers into swans and their sister into a mute
[b]A Father's Dying Wish[/b]
Before his death, their father sent them away to protect them from the curse, and scattered [u]golden feathers[/u] with his confession about why the kingdom was cursed. 
[b]The Search for Freedom[/b]
The Dark Swan spent years searching for a way to break the curse and met the Peacock Lady, who offered him an amulet to stay in human form and made him her apprentice.
[b]A Dark Deed[/b]
Under her orders, he kidnapped his own nephew and fought and killed his brothers who tried to save him.
[b]The Betrayal[/b]
At the Dark Castle, the Dark Swan learns that the Peacock Lady was using him to harm his family instead of breaking the curse. This is because she was angry at the Queen for resembling the Swan Queen, whom the Dark Swan's father loved. In a fit of rage, the Dark Swan tries to hurt her but she removed the amulet and turn him into stone.
[b]Redemption and Sacrifice[/b]
The Healer saves the Dark Swan from being turned to stone and gives him a shirt that allows him to become human again. The Dark Swan wants to make up for his past actions and helps the Healer enter a castle to save his family.

When the evil plan of the Peacock Lady is revealed, the Dark Swan comes to the Healer's defense. In a brave move, he sacrifices himself by jumping off the castle wall with the Peacock Lady into the sea, leading to his death.

[b]A Bittersweet Ending[/b]
The Dark Swan's sacrifice was not in vain. The Healer was able to break the curse on his family, saving his sister and nephew. Although he didn't survive, his efforts led to their freedom.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198969396473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1612477185}
review:
The artwork really caught my attention at first for this game but then as I started playing I instantly recognised the story used for this game, it's based of the Brother's Grimm: The Six Swans. It's one of my favourite fairytale stories and I'm really impressed how they adapted it and made it into a new story to play (nearly feels like a Disney movie only with blood added in) - I highly enjoyed this and definitely recommend!

Note: Even though this game are a series they don't tie in to each other - this is a standalone so you don't have to play the rest of the series if you don't want to

  Likes:
[list]
[*]The plot - a really good adaption, I felt inspired but for anyone familiar to the story then they will instantly recognise it at the beginning of the game

[*]The Artwork - really beautiful and very well styled, the hidden objects are all flawlessly hidden and don't look out of place, a lot of effort has been put into it

[*]The Puzzles - besides Hidden Objects there are puzzles to figure out, not really challenging but it adds variety to the game

[*]Another thing I like about this game are the collectables - they're scattered around the game for you to find
[/list]
  Dislikes:
[list]
[*]There are no save points or restarts - if you miss a collectable or achievement you will have to either create a new profile or play through the current game and then play through it again to get where you want

[*]The achievements and collectables menu - nothing is really labelled and it got me quite confused where everything was
[/list]

review:
One of the better hidden object games. 

Nice environment, nice crisp images, nice story, nice puzzles... it's just nice. Voice acting is up to its usual standard of a few mates in the back of a shed could do better. But anyone who has played an Aritfex game will come in prepared for that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198329697051', 'num_games_owned': 388, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1612249611}
review:
I've played quite a few hidden object games, and I think I like this one the most when considering its story. I felt the story was more cohesive, and made more sense within its universe, than some of the ones I've played before. There were certainly some points where it didn't quite make sense story-wise. [spoiler]Like, why is the girl mute versus the others. Unless you want to go the route that it effects girls differently.[/spoiler] 

There was maybe only one or two instances where I felt stuck, but was otherwise fine. Compared to the previous game in the series, I feel this one is more interesting. That said, I did figure out part of the secret of the swans long before its reveal.


Edit: I just wanted to add, one thing I hated the most was the voice acting for the young boys. Truly abrasive to my ears. Probably the only thing that really bothered me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198422181749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 724, 'last_played': 1612125423}
review: Very polished, well created game. It also contains an extra story after finishing the main storyline. Very Recommended. The swan brothers are pretty creepy, though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11196, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1612093949}
review:
This is a routine hidden object casual puzzle/adventure game with a historical/fantasy/mystery theme. Solving various puzzles and hidden object minigames reveals the plot and uncovers the mystery.

Once more we see Artifex Mundi trying to scam PC gamers. On Steam, this is $10 USD, on app stores, it's completely free. Mobile devs must learn PC gamers are not here to be gouged, and can't be expected to pay a premium for a free mobile game just because it's been lazily dumped on Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198452116103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1611941141}
review: This game was decent. While the characters and story are interesting, the player character is also fairly cold and difficult to like. She's very callous for an alleged healer, and it wouldn't be hard to change her dialogue just a little to be kinder. The hidden object puzzles and general puzzles are good and the game was simple enough to beat on Expert mode. Maybe get it if you can get it on sale; I'm not sure it's worth full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087874412', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1609638927}
review:
Another one of your typical HOGs.

The best "Pro" I can give to this one is that you can get all achievements on your first playthrough--if you're observant enough, that is. There are "healer glyphs" you must click on, but unlike a lot of other HOGs, once you progress beyond a certain point, you can no longer backtrack to previous areas, locking you out from finding them all.

Now, for the "Cons." Not all the puzzle solutions are obvious, and some are just downright illogical--a few of them devolve into a "try-everything-until-it-works" theory.
Also, this one is for mature players. There's dead bodies in it. And on-screen (kind of) deaths. Typically in these game you come across ghosts and skeletons that speak of their demise, but this one puts it right there in front of you. And for no reason, one of the dead bodies can be zoomed in on with a magnifying glass for no purpose--traditionally in these games if a "zoomed in" scene is done, you're no longer given the option to do so; some exceptions include zooms that contain in-game text or lore to help you with the story. But this one allows you to zoom on the dead body for no reason. There's no text, no lore, nothing. Doesn't make sense.

All-in-all, I'm not recommending this one because of the somewhat frustrating solutions to many of the puzzles. For an example: [spoiler]One particular scene wants you to build a fire, but when you try to put some "twigs" down, it says "You need to put kindling down first." Well, that's what twigs are for--I've started fires many times and twigs are what I use for kindling. Turns out what you actually need to put down are some mushrooms. What!? I've never used mushrooms for kindling, but apparently the devs have, so it's logic like that in this game that's why I don't like this one.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197964923935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1609473310}
review: Although, I don't think it's as good as the first, it's still very good. It seemed shorter to me, and a tad easier. The voice acting is... questionable but adequate. Getting 100% achievements is easy, and like other Artifex Mundi games, it's visually pleasing and has nice music. My only gripe is the hidden symbols in each screen seem fairly low-effort compared to the hand drawn fairies you find in the previous game (play the first game to understand what I mean). That being said, I still recommended this game and enjoyed its setting and story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001238399', 'num_games_owned': 535, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1609135006}
review:
I havent played a hidden object/puzzle game like this in about 10 years, for some reason I ended up buying this on a whim and played with it some friends over Discord for kicks n' giggles, solving the puzzles together and having a good laugh as the plot unfolded. We had a lot of fun with this! It was pretty simple at times, and I don't think there were enough challenges, but most of the solutions were logical.

The bonus chapter was a little odd in terms of both story theme, clashing pretty bad, since the main storyline is pretty dark and a bunch of characters die with no fanfare, the bonus chapter is a very goofy storyline that is a prequel to the main story, but doesn't add much.

Plot 4/10 - terribly boring. It may fit for children under 10 y.o. though.
Game logics 6/10 - events flow could be more thought through

Ukrainian language isn't available in game, and this is the most sad point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085858209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1601876236}
review:
I enjoyed this one but I do think the first Grim Legends is a bit better. 

Story: 4.5/5
Quite good! Well-developed, perfectly paced, plenty of drama and tragedy, decent character development...The ending is a tad bit rushed but not a big deal. I liked how the bonus chapter was not directly related to the main story but added a little more depth to the world the game takes place in.

Voice Acting: 4.5/5
Great for the most part! I don't have many complaints here. The kids sounded a little bit bland but it wasn't a big deal.

Graphics: 5/5
Very beautiful environments/locations, good CGI sequences, very colorful, and good facial animations.

Music/Sound: 5/5
Great soundtrack, like always.

Hidden Object Puzzles: 4.5/5
Many of them were focused on finding very specific items (like colored glass pieces) to create something instead of just finding random things within a scene. It's a nice change of pace, although, sometimes, these types of Hidden Object Puzzles can make my eyes tired since things blend in far too well at times.

Other Puzzles: 3.5/5
Some were fun but some were too tedious for my tastes. 

Final Grade: 90%

An entertaining HOG that may have some flaws but I think it's still worth the $10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061895298', 'num_games_owned': 1071, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1601774349}
review: Excellent use of hidden objects and engaging puzzles.  The story was quite good and I really enjoyed the artwork in the game.  The voice acting wasn't the best, but overall one of the best Hidden Objects games I've played yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033388937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 294, 'playtime_forever': 2082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2082, 'last_played': 1601380107}
review:
The first Artifex Mundi game I played, and still a favourite. Just replayed it to get the achievement I missed a few years ago :)

Entertaining, with a nicely organized and presented story. I'm not a fan of the protagonist's voice acting (it's okay), but the other adult voices are quite good. The art is pretty - not especially detailed, but charming and works with the fairy tale setting. The HO scenes are varied and pleasant, if only a few challenges.  There is decent variety in the puzzles, too.  The bonus chapter feels rather childish, and isn't nearly as good as the main game, although the latter half isn't bad.

Maybe not the most exciting HOPA game out there, but I enjoyed replaying it and it does have good controls, no bugs, interesting collectable signs, and an interactive map.  A great place to start and I'd still recommend it today, although I'd probably wait until a sale and/or buy it in one of the two available bundles.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998116681', 'num_games_owned': 3146, 'num_reviews': 600, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1599661858}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QxjSlj8Bllo

So, it's a second game, but you play as a different protagonist? It's a usual Artifex Mundi style HOPA with associated quality of gameplay and above average art. But once again it uses terrible morph animation. Mostly it goes smooth but here and there you can stumble upon a puzzle which nears P&C levels of moon logic. Once again you have helper mechanic, and there are several of them for narrative reasons. But at least this time it tries to get your attention harder. This game doesn't have domino alternative to HO parts, so you can do all of the achievements in one run. Though, collectibles are very well hidden and there are several sawtooths. All achievements are working, they are either track the collectibles, story progression or test player's mastery of the genre. But also there's one to pester butterflies.

brutal.jpg

The story is inspired by the De vilde svaner and it's unexpectedly brutal. The whole plot is kind of cool and ties everything together into a neat tangle. But the very ending is congraturation-tier weak.
The bonus story is in two parts. In the first one you play as a fairy and it's extra cool with their city and their simlish. In the second one you play as the princess and it would be cool too, but there puzzles reach peak bothersome.

https://coub.com/view/2j1ivr

author: {'steamid': '76561198129771193', 'num_games_owned': 799, 'num_reviews': 303, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1599529637}
review:
For the most part a typical Artifex Mundi HOG, though the story was entirely predictable.

Pros:
- Most of the minigames aren't too bad
- Most of the HOG scenes involve trying to find parts for something that will be useful, rather than the 'find this specific junk in a pile of junk in order to get a completely unrelated item' type of scenes

Cons:
- For the most part the voice acting is amaturish
- Predictable ending
- Some of the minigames boil down to trail and error
- Collectible achievement, but you can't go back to all areas. I missed 2 in the castle, and was really glad you end up going back later in the story. For no obvious reason though, you can't go to places in the castle from the beginning, so I still missed the achievement.

Verdict: 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198083880494', 'num_games_owned': 979, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1599199575}
review: Interesting story, I suspected the villain early on but reaching the conclusion and gathering the evidence took about 7 hours (though I did skip a couple of mini games) Typical Hidden Objects + mini games + visual novel (fully voiced) from Artifex Mundi. You've played any of their games you will be familiar with their quality, they have been at this a long time and know what they are doing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013317302', 'num_games_owned': 4119, 'num_reviews': 253, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1599147001}

author: {'steamid': '76561197979624515', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1599426267}
review: I never thought I would enjoy a game like this - story and riddles, no "manual expertise" needed whatsoever. I really did though and will play more Artifex Mundi games FOR SURE.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985130407', 'num_games_owned': 818, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1594277881}
review:
The Grim Legends formula that I came to enjoy from The Forsaken Bride carries over into its sequel, though I have mixed feelings about Dark Swan.  Everything is generally great, from the art to the story to the puzzles to the voice acting, but I felt some missteps were made.

The Grim Legends games always have plot twists, but they telegraphed the first twist of Dark Swan way too hard.  From the first five minutes of the game, I saw it coming.  The other plot twists were fine, though.

The thing that most disappointed me about Dark Swan compared to the first game, and the third too, is the inclusion of puzzles that fall outside of what I call "the sweet spot."  The sweet spot is when a puzzle is  just complicated enough that you feel compelled to figure out how it works, yet not so complicated that it requires writing down charts or tables because the interactions are too complex to keep in your mind.

There were a couple puzzles like this in Dark Swan, and I even got frustrated to the point of using a hint to skip one of them.

I'm reviewing all the Grim Legends games one after the other, so I don't want to repeat what I like about Grim Legends from [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/Eincrou/recommended/284850/]my review of Grim Legends: The Forsaken Bride[/url], but I enjoyed this game a lot.  And thankfully the issues I have with it were not repeated in Grim Legends 3: The Dark City.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971838196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 356, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1593525638}
review:
Spielwertung: 10/10

Eines der besten Spiele aus dem Hause Artifex Mundi

+ Geschichte ist, verwoben als M√§rchen, stimmig und atmosph√§risch
+ Grafik ist wie immer sch√∂n gezeichnet, mit ausdrucksstarken Farben
+ Sound und Ton sind nicht aufdringlich, vielleicht je nach Bedarf die Grundeinstellungen etwas runterdrehen
+ Die R√§tsel sind allesamt auf anst√§ndigem Niveau, die Wimmelbilder fair
+ Nur selten braucht man Hilfe, wenn √ºberhaupt, es gibt ein paar knifflige Stellen
+ Von der Spielzeit sollte man nicht zu viel erwarten, aber rund 3 Stunden + Extrakapitel, das ebenfalls punkten kann, sind durchaus √ºberdurchschnittlich f√ºr diese Spiele
+ S√§mtliche Erfolge sind ohne gro√üen Aufwand m√∂glich. Wer es in einem Run schaffen will, sollte, wie immer, direkt auf schwierig spielen. 
+ Die "Besonderheit" an "Grim Legends 2": Finde alle 31 Heiler-Symbole, in jedem Raum ist ziemlich sicher genau 1, man muss sich also nicht viel Gedanken machen. Beim ersten Run hatte ich 30 (klar), im 2. Run konnte ich den Fehlenden schnell finden. Es ist wirklich nicht schwer, wenn man sich Zeit f√ºr die sch√∂nen R√§ume nimmt. 

Fazit: Wie immer gilt: An und f√ºr sich kein spektakul√§res Videospiel, eher etwas f√ºr den kurzen Genuss, aber aus seinem Genre der (√ºber)-durchschnittlichen Point&Clicks ist "Song of the Dark Swan" ein sehr guter Vertreter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113243844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1589268787}
review:
"Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan" stands out as overwhelmingly gorgeous among many beautiful titles. 

Every detail, from scenes to trading cards, badges, and color schemes, is crafted with exceptional care. The backgrounds are particularly enchanting, and the overall aesthetic drew me in. The story's resemblance to "Swan Lake" and "The Swan Princess" adds a dreamy and lovely touch. Additionally, the well-executed puzzles contribute to the game's overall appeal. 

It's an experience that is completely worth playing for those who appreciate beauty and engaging gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032596719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1590446870}
review:
I'm really enjoying the Grim Legends series so far.  It's interesting that the stories don't interconnect at all.  (I really miss Enigmatis!) 
 Each takes place in a different world in a different time.  This one follows the template of the plights of two monarchies that succumbed to a powerful evil.  Most of the mini games and HO are pretty straight forward minus a couple of tooth gnashers.  Beautifully drawing backgrounds, but with a somewhat repetitive soundtrack.  Mute it!  Otherwise, an enjoyable way to pass an afternoon.  I got about 8 hours for $3.

review:
Played Grim Legends 1 before this. 
Found this shorter, and relatively easier to follow (felt palatable enough to replay to get all achievements; hadn't bothered with the first one as I felt it would take too long). Did get stuck on a couple of puzzles along the way though. Overall liked this one better than the first - maybe I'm getting  used to such games, so I didn't get as lost as the first one. 

Saw some comments where people liked the voice acting, or at least called it above average. I haven't played enough of these to comment, but the voices got on my nerves lol! 

Nevertheless, nice game, nice graphics, overall decent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067593196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1694532902}
review:
"Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan", Hauptspiel + Bonuskapitel, ist das beste Wimmelbildspiel vom Betreiber Artifex Mundi, was ich bisher gespielt habe.

Pro:
+ Die Spielmusik ist sehr sch√∂n. Beste √ºberhaupt bisher. Mich hat dieser abwechslungsreiche epische Soundtrack von Anfang an gepackt und in seinen Bann gezogen.
+ Gelungene Soundeffekte und sch√∂ne englische Sprachausgabe. Die beste √ºberhaupt bisher.
+ Die Spielgrafik ist sehr sch√∂n. Die Beste √ºberhaupt bisher. Ich habe mich das erste Mal wie in einem echten Grafik-Point & Click Adventure gef√ºhlt. Alleine schon die Wasseranimationen sind echt toll geworden: Animierte Luftblasen usw.. Alles rund und harmonisch und viel nat√ºrlicher als in meinen bisherigen anderen Wimmelbildspielen.
+ Sehr sch√∂ne Videos. Gute Idee mit den goldenen Federn zur Freischaltung, Weitererz√§hlen des M√§rchens.
+ Beste Spielkarte bisher. Alle Orte sind sehr sch√∂n und liebevoll auf der Karte eingezeichnet und markiert worden.
+ Beste und genauste Maussteuerung bisher. So direkt und angenehm war die Maussteuerung in keinem meiner bisherigen Wimmelbildspiele.
+ Minispiele und Wimmelbilder waren sehr abwechslungsreich und angenehm f√ºr das Auge abzusuchen. Die Minispiele waren herausragend und neben den Minispielen aus "The secret 3 "die mit Abstand besten vom Spa√ü-, Anspruchs- und Abwechslungsfaktor.
+ Die Wimmelbilder waren grafisch sehr viel besser als das was ich bisher gekannt habe, und es hat Spa√ü gemacht diese abzusuchen.
+ Die allgemeinen Adventure-Elemente, Point & Click-Kombinationen waren auch mit das Beste bisher. Alles gut nachvollziehbar.
+ Steigender Schwierigkeitsgrad im weiteren Spielverlauf. Die h√∂chste Stufe "Schwer" hat sehr viel Spa√ü gemacht.
+ glaubhafte ordentlich Story. Das Schwanenthema von den Gebr√ºder Grimm mit Befreiung der Br√ºder und Rettung der Prinzessin hat mir sehr gut gefallen. Das ist generell echt gut gemacht in den ganzen Grim Legends-Spielen.
+ Drei verschiedene Begleiter im Laufe des Spiels und jeder mit unterschiedlichen F√§higkeiten
+ Sch√∂nste Tieranimationen bisher. Egal ob Schmetterlinge, andere Insekten oder Tiere, die nach dem Anclicken weiterfliegen, verschwinden oder entsprechende Ger√§usche von sich geben.
+ Als Zusatz konnte ich 31 verschiedene Heilerzeichen im Spiel entdecken, um ein gro√üer Bild in den Auszeichnungen aufzudecken. Diese habe ich gerne auf jedem neuen Bildabschnitt gesucht und sie waren deutlich leichter zu finden als im Vorg√§nger "Grim Legends 1".

Kontra:
- Der Schwierigkeitsgrad war im ersten Spieldrittel viel zu einfach. Entsprechend schnell bin ich auf das Schwanenboot gekommen. Trotzdem habe ich mir viel Zeit gelassen, die R√§tsel bewusst mir selbst schwieriger gemacht, und habe das Spiel mit all seinen Grafiken und Sounds sehr genie√üen k√∂nnen.
- Die deutsche √úbersetzung war an einigen Stellen grammatikalisch sehr schlampig umgesetzt worden. Aber das ist "Jammern" auf hohem Niveau.
- Das Tagebuch ist weiterhin sehr schlicht gehalten. Es sind lediglich die Spielziele vermerkt.
- Etwas k√ºrzere Spielzeit als bei einigen anderen Wimmelspielen. 11 statt 13-14 Stunden. Aber zusammen mit dem Bonuskapitel reicht das allemal, da zweistellig in Stunden.

Fazit: In sehr vielen Punkten das beste Wimmelspiel bisher. Am Ende hatte ich alle Errungenschaften gemeistert, die zu erreichen waren. Sehr viele Pros und wenige Kontras, die kaum der Rede wert sind. K√ºnftige Wimmelspiele werden sich an diese Messlatte halten m√ºssen, was sie wert sind. Dieses Spiel hier hat verdammt viel richtig gemacht. Ein gro√ües Lob meinerseits an alle, die an diesem Spiel und dessen Entwicklung beteiligt waren.

Pers√∂nliche Rangfolge:
1. Grim Legends 2
2. Enigmatis 2
3. Grim Legends 1
4. The secret Order 3
5. The secret Order 2
6. Enigmatis 1

N√§chstes Spiel auf dass ich mich vorab sehr freue: ;-)
Queens Quest 1

author: {'steamid': '76561198307908110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1590635275}
review:
I loved this story a lot more than I thought I would.  Of course, I was excited to play it just because of the title, but the story got more and more interesting the further along I got.  The characters were absolutely wonderful, and I never would have suspected the villain being who they were!  Sadly, it did seem like a relatively quick game in comparison to the previous game, but it certainly wasn't lacking in story or interest!

[spoiler]I really, really enjoyed the aspect of the swans being the Queen's siblings, and that they were cursed, but could become human with the nettle shirts she would make for them.  I was rather upset that may of them had lost their lives trying to break the curse, but at least some of them lived...   The Dark Swan was my favorite character though.  He was a handsome fellow, and he really did care about his family and others.  He was just taken advantage of by the Sorceress because he wanted to break the curse, and while I am upset that he gave his life in the end to end hers, I'm glad he was able to redeem himself and his actions.[/spoiler]

Definitely would recommend playing this game, even if you haven't played the first.  It was an incredible game~

author: {'steamid': '76561198264305879', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1578758693}
review: I played Grim Legends 2 awhile ago, after completing the first game in the series.  I did enjoy the game and the puzzles, but not quite so much as the first game.  I think the story was one of the reasons why, as these games tend to be a little longer, and therefore sometimes I would have trouble even remembering where I was at with the story and how one thing connected to the other.  Still enjoyable enough to play through though!

review:
Un petit jeu d'objets cach√©s avec des puzzles dont certains que j'ai trouv√©s difficiles. 
J'ai pr√©f√©r√© le premier opus dans sa logique car sur ce deuxi√®me volet on reste facilement bloqu√©s - certains objets √† trouver n'√©tant pas "mis en valeur". L'histoire cependant est tr√®s sympathique et on se prend d'affection pour cette princesse et souhaitons terminer notre qu√™te de la v√©rit√©.

Les succ√®s, contrairement au 1er √©pisode, sont tous r√©alisables facilement.
Je ne connaissais pas ce style de jeu, je suis plut√¥t Point&Clic mais j'y trouve un  c√¥t√© rafra√Æchissant avec ces jolies couleurs et musiques tr√®s agr√©ables. Le jeu √©tant un peu court tout de m√™me, mieux vaut attendre qu'il soit en solde pour l'acheter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167638706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1585674155}
review:
Nice episode. I probably enjoyed the first one in this series a bit more but still a good quality hidden object game with some nice art.
Some of the puzzles were a bit annoying, since the objects you have to find don't always make sense and they look just like a few random lines (parts of an amulet sorta thing) but not that often.
English voice acting is horrible for some characters but it's not that disturbing here. 
Again, I really liked the art, the imagery. Always looking forward to seeing a new area.

author: {'steamid': '76561198386287993', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1585109576}
review: Not to say this is a "typical" hiddeon object game but this is one of the good ones.  The style of art, the story is well crafted, most of the things make some kind of logical sense.  I'm impressed and will be looking into this companies other games.  I played this with my daughter and we topped out at 6 hours on this one and 6 hours on part 3 which is also pretty great game.  Part 3 is a bit more puzzle games than hidden object but still pretty good.  We are working on #1 and we are both liking this series.

author: {'steamid': '76561199011907483', 'num_games_owned': 36, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1584238952}
review:
This sequel is even better than the first game, from both a technical and design standpoint. The story is a bit less developed and emotional than the original's but the game makes up for it by offering an intriguing mystery that slowly unfolds as you progress. The art design and styling is gorgeous throughout. The backgrounds are lighter in tone this time around as the action takes place mostly during daytime, which is refreshing.

Overall I highly recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198199095445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1583927163}
review:
High quality hidden object game without any severe issues. Very good visuals and sound (with one exception I'll get into), interesting story, and extremely polished gameplay (both in terms of actual hidden object screens and minigames/puzzles). 

The one admittedly minor, but still grating irritation I encountered were the voices they chose for all the kid characters. They're voiced by actual children who sound like they don't even understand the words coming out of their mouths. The main character is competently voiced, but sounds a bit bored all the way through, so voice acting isn't the game's strong suit in general. Doesn't matter, really, the game's still above the average HOG level of quality. 

Also, the title of this Steam release doesn't specify this for some reason, but the version being sold here is the "collector's edition" of the game, meaning there's additional content included, most notably one post-game bonus chapter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198821234868', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 2250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2250, 'last_played': 1582314614}
review: Me encanta el t√≠tulo que tiene al castellano "leyendas deprimentes", lo de deprimente le queda genial. Como juego es algo mejor que el primero, pero los cambios en la historia los veo muy bruscos, muchas de las cosas no me acaban de convencer, aunque se puede decir que al menos no llega a aburrir. Una parte de las traducciones est√°n mal, parece que empieza a ocurrir con muchos de los juegos de artifex, poni√©ndolo en ingl√©s se acaba el problema, pero siempre me agrada m√°s jugar en mi idioma nativo, supongo que no todo se puede tener. No entiendo muy bien qu√© demonios usan para traducir, supongo que no usan una persona y habr√°n usado un traductor de textos poco afinado. Tiene un capitulo extra que deber√≠a ser un gran aliciente para jugar, lo cierto que es parece que lo han metido con calzador y no han sabido darle el toque que tiene el juego, queda muy raro aunque lo agradezco y no quiero parecer desagradecida, pero la verdad es que yo hubiera hecho mejor sin mucho esfuerzo. Recomendable, pero como segunda parte algo floja y muy alejada del primero.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041663794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1578283908}
review:
I really enjoyed the story in this game. I've played a lot of HOG type games, but this was really good as far as the story went. I was pleased with it. I enjoyed most of the HOG's. There were a couple that were challenging and some of the minigames were annoying, but nothing was too difficult. I will say that I didn't enjoy the fact that most of the minigames didn't have a "reset" button so you couldn't just reset if you messed up. That made some of them harder than they would've otherwise been. 

The game has an extra chapter that I really liked. There's a map that allows fast travel. There are achievements, too.

In general, if you like fantasy stories and HOG's, you will probably enjoy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960393604', 'num_games_owned': 2763, 'num_reviews': 243, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1578268142}
review: Yea, this is the kind of game I expect from these Artifex Mundi games.  Puzzles are good, hidden object puzzles are fun - and come in two varieties.  The usual "find a list of items", and a second "find a bunch of this specific item".  That latter works pretty well.  The story on this one is decent, for what it is.  I also really like the sigil used for the hidden one-per screen item.  With one exception: Late in the game you revisit areas, it's counted as new areas.  That was the only one I missed my first time though, though it was fairly obvious.  My only real minor complaints are that they reused, exactly, one puzzle from the previous game.  Wouldn't be quite so bad if it was just one from a random game, but this is literally the sequel to that one and they have an exact duplicate puzzle.  Not good.  Some of the other puzzles are old classics (sliding puzzles).  But those are fairly minor.  Even the bonus game was pretty fun.  And they managed to avoid the "there's plenty of areas to light the torch, but only one REAL one" issue this time when they had the torch.  There really was only one place to light it.  Overall, yea, this is probably one of the best Artifax Mundi games out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198285534338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1641430348}
review:
Artifex Mundi Studio... Grim Legends.. no wonder why I wasn't dissapointed.
One of my favourite HOG series.

Great story, nice balance between mini-games and HOgames. The mini-games wasn't too hard, but 2-3 of them took time to complete. In my opininon that was good. Even the background music was so good. 
I was sorry we couldn't explore the finished areas for the sigils, but this is whatever.

Highly recommended who love HOGs!

author: {'steamid': '76561198197234309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 898, 'last_played': 1573273324}
review:
Not really sure why this is a series when it's really not. Grim legends 2 has literally nothing to do with the first one. Still a decent game, just not sure why they did that unless it was just a marketing ploy to get more people to buy it due to the success of the first one. 

Artifex Mundi really does develop some of the best HOG's on the market.I can honestly say that I have never been really disappointed in any of them. HOG's are by definition fairly predictable in game play and story line and yet they do a surprising job of keeping it fresh. As well as keeping the audio and visual quality of their games on par with current levels of technology. I'm not going to go too in depth about the game itself other than to say it really is pretty good for an HOG and my only confusion comes from the titling I brought up earlier. LOL still 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198030546687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1562572542}
review:
I usually enjoy Artifex Mundi games, but this was painfully dull.
Story all over the place, objectives often unclear, puzzles simplistic and after finding new items - or even after completing the tasks - I'm still confused as to how they fit together. 
The first Grim Legends game was good, but after this I'd rather recommend Ghosts of Maple Creek or Nightmares from the Deep.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091958907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 710, 'last_played': 1596570133}
review:
Highly recommend!  

Pros
.Enchanting story
.Gorgeous artwork/graphics/scenes
.Beautiful, enriching music
.Enhancing sounds/voice acting  
.Fairy tale atmosphere
.Three difficulty modes (no custom)
.Mini-map with fast travel
.Lockable toolbar
.Objects glow when in place for possible use
.Complex adventure play
.Challenging hidden object scenes
.Easy to moderately difficult mini-puzzles
.Collectable (healer sigil) 
.Bonus chapter
.Good length
.No cons

Final words (10/10):
Beautiful, beautiful game.  Very immersive.  Worth playing for the visuals and music alone.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977197768', 'num_games_owned': 3607, 'num_reviews': 458, 'playtime_forever': 876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1700572681}
review:
Grim Legends 2 nous conte l'histoire de la reine du royaume des aigles qui se retrouve accus√© de sorcellerie pour l'enl√®vement de son fils alors que notre h√©ro√Øne allait l'aider en tant que gu√©risseuse pour l'aider pour un probl√®me de voix car celle ci ne pouvait prononcer un mot... Il y a jour comme cela o√π rien ne se passe comme il faut mais c'est pas grave il faut prendre les choses comme elles sont ^^

On se met alors en qu√™te d'indices afin d'innocenter la reine...

L'histoire est agr√©able √† suivre et est soutenue par un choix graphique et une palette de couleur qui met bien en valeur le c√¥t√© "conte" de notre aventure.

Une fois n'est pas coutume, on a une traduction pas trop "bizarre" d'Artifex, ce qui permet de nous plonger dans notre qu√™te sans √™tre bloqu√© par un nom d'objet qui ne correspond √† rien ^^

Il y a tr√®s peu de SOC et beaucoup ne demandent que de chercher un seul (ou deux) objets en plusieurs exemplaires... on aime ou pas.. En ce qui concerne les puzzles, ils sont simples √† faire et ne posent pas de probl√®mes outre mesure. 
Petit b√©mol pour ma part en mode expert o√π il m'est arriv√© deux fois de ne pas trop comprendre ce que l'on attendait de moi mais on finit pas s'y retrouver √† force de cliquer.

Il y a un chapitre bonus mais qui est non seulement anecdotique mais aussi tr√®s, tr√®s court...

Ce deuxi√®me √©pisode de la s√©rie Grim Legends est un tr√®s bon hidden sans compter que pour les amateurs de succ√®s (et de "collections" d'objets), ils sont disponibles et peu ou pas difficile √† obtenir...

author: {'steamid': '76561198034928324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1558477141}
review:
Come tutti i giochi della artifex mundi, ricicla un po quello che sono gli enigmi dai precedenti giochi, ma se si √® appassionati dei giochi stile "trova l'oggetto" si lascia giocare con tranquillit√†.
Stavolta la traduzione in italiano non casca nei soliti strafalcioni causando delle incomprensioni sull'oggetto da trovare e tutto sommato la storia risulta piacevole nel suo incedere.
Tecnicamente non spicca rispetto ai titoli dello stesso sviluppatore, non sono stati fatti passi in avanti infatti in tal senso.
Consigliato solo a chi ha gi√† giocato altri titoli della artifex mundi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081340622', 'num_games_owned': 5267, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1552433841}
review:
Possibly the most laughably short and ridiculous ending(s) I've found in a game, and that includes both the main game and its bonus chapter. Seriously, we play those for the mini-games and the beautiful graphics and music, but really..? They couldn't afford to spend more than a minute on a proper ending? Lol.
I also had a hard time understanding the story. I thought it was an adaptation of The Wild Swans, but it lost me halfway through. Also, there are only a couple of tracks that play during the game, so even though they're very soothing, the soundtrack still lacks in diversity.
Other than that, it's pretty great, just don't buy it on the Steam store, you can pretty get it for free for it's been rebundled so many times at IndieGala and the likes (Artifex Mundi likes to do that). Seriously, just go to a game trading website like my own Lestrades.com (shameless plug), SteamTrades or Barter, and politely ask anyone who owns the game, they're likely to give it to you for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052332539', 'num_games_owned': 976, 'num_reviews': 334, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1547251025}
review:
[h1]*Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan* - Eine Reise ins Schwanenk√∂nigreich[/h1]

Auch der zweite Teil von Grim Legends √ºberzeugt. Vor allem die Geschichte um die K√∂nigin und ihre verwunschenen Br√ºder hat mir sehr gut gefallen. Man kennt diese in abgewandelter Form als M√§rchen "Die sechs Schw√§ne".

Auch bei "Song of the Dark Swan" finden wir wieder eine gelungene Mischung aus abwechslungsreichen Wimmelbildern und Mini-Spielen vor, die alle vom Schwierigkeitsgrad her auch auf der Stufe "Expert" sehr gut machbar sind. Ein Sammelmodus, dieses Mal f√ºr Heilersiegel, ist auch im zweiten Teil integriert. Ebenfalls wieder mit dabei sind verschiedene tierische Begleiter, welche in unterschiedlichen Situationen gerne aushelfen. Dies gef√§llt mir immer besonders gut.

Alles in allem wieder ein rundum gelungenes Hidden-Object-Game, bei dem Fans des Genres auf ihre Kosten kommen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048825498', 'num_games_owned': 569, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 837, 'last_played': 1538076473}
review:
Segunda aventura de la saga Grim Legends, y segundo gran juego. Saga ideal para iniciarse en las aventuras gr√°ficas. La presentaci√≥n es exquisita, tanto a nivel de men√∫s como de escenarios, con una m√∫sica de fondo que le sienta como un guante. Se nota que estos apartados est√°n hechos con gran dedicaci√≥n. A nivel jugable sigue la estela de la primera entrega. No revoluciona el g√©nero, pero en mi opini√≥n no cae en la excesiva repetici√≥n de determinadas mec√°nicas como s√≠ han hecho otros t√≠tulos de este corte. Es entretenido de principio a fin. La dificultad Experto es la m√°s recomendable, ya que no es un juego demasiado complicado a la hora de encontrar objetos y no soy muy partidario de que resalten objetos. 
En cuanto a los puzzles, la mayor√≠a no son complicados, aunque de vez en cuando nos toparemos con algunos que costar√°n un poco m√°s (hay uno en especial que creo que lo pusieron demasiado dif√≠cil).
Las voces est√°n en ingl√©s, pero todo lo dem√°s (subt√≠tulos, mensajes, men√∫s, pistas) est√°n en castellano, y adem√°s con un muy buen nivel de traducci√≥n.
Por todo esto, es un juego y una saga que merece la pena, como casi todo lo que viene haciendo Artifex Mundi.
