author: {'steamid': '76561198052802708', 'num_games_owned': 1433, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1537455108}
review:
[h1][b][i]Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan[/i] is an excellent successor to the first title in the series that can also be played as a stand alone game.[/b][/h1]

[h1]Intro/Synopsis[/h1]
[i]Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan[/i] takes the formula of success that made the first title so appealing, and moves to a new realm but retains its familiar style. We‚Äôre no longer in the traditional fairytales of Brother‚Äôs Grimm, but in a setting more akin to Hans Christian Anderson, with a mysterious Queen, forbidden magic, an enigmatic Queen Mother and the tragic history of two kingdoms‚Ä¶ All of this packaged neatly into a standard Hidden Object game, that is a visual treat and has solidly designed puzzles and scenes.

[list]
[b]+Pros[/b]
[*]Detailed artwork that will immerse you in a fairytale like atmosphere
[*]Interesting variety of puzzles and Hidden Object scenes
[*]Competent storyline with a traditional moral at the end
[*]Can be played as a stand alone title

[b]-Cons[/b]
[*]Areas of the game become closed off, so you can‚Äôt search for collectibles
[*]Doesn‚Äôt expand or innovate on the previous title
[*]Poor cut-scene transitions 
[*]Lack of scalable difficulty within the puzzles.
[/list]

[h1] Narrative[/h1]
[i]Song of the Dark Swan[/i] does not follow the story of the previous game, instead we are introduced to an entirely new realm, with new unique characters. The cast is rather large, and you‚Äôll be meeting characters right until near the end of the game. This doesn‚Äôt leave much time for any to develop significantly and I was left feeling as if I were still a stranger to most of them. There‚Äôs also a lot of information given about one particular character‚Ä¶ whom we get to interact with perhaps 3 times throughout the game, which felt as though it could have been handled more effectively.

Like most HoGs we are expected to act morally and compassionately without giving any incentive to do so, or with true heartfelt meaning. It left me a little cold. On the other hand the protagonist, is supposed to be a healer so at least within the context you‚Äôre actions are still validated and make sense.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1517819542
Again, like its prequel, many characters are archetypal, and perform their roles with finesse. In this aspect the writing is very strong and draws on the wealth of cultural tales and folklore to which numerous allusions are made. It‚Äôs classic good vs evil tale encouraging fantasy escapism at its best. There is a lot of influences here and is reminscent of stories like ‚ÄúThe Firebird‚Äù and ‚ÄúSwan Lake‚Äù  not merely because of a bird theme, but also due to a strong focus on a romantic relationship as well as strongly enforced family values. In this way the game reinforces its moral theme as well, since the focus is primarily around a family tragedy that unfolds, and the reasons to why it occurs. 

This background story is incorporated nicely into the gameplay, and like previous games, certain puzzles will provide exposition and further clarify the backstory as you progress. 
The plot unfolds at a fast pace, quickly driving you on to the next part. At times it feels a little too fast, especially as the game isn‚Äôt particularly long, but it does slowly escalate the tension which leads to a fairly satisfying conclusion. 
The writing itself won‚Äôt win any awards, lacking in poetry, but it is competent and generally a pleasant read.

[h1] Gameplay[/h1]
[i]Song of the Dark Swan[/i] is very much similar to its predecessor in terms of gameplay. Many puzzles are recycled and reinvented to fit the new story and context. Which is often a part of the appeal of HOPA‚Äôs as receiving new versions of established favourites is often a compelling reason to play. It would be nice to see some innovation for a change or new unique types of puzzles being included though.

The Hidden Object scenes are an absolute joy to play. The selection area is generous but not overly so, and the lists easy to follow. Some item placement is rather ingenious and the items are quite well hidden.You‚Äôll have your normal variations on puzzles including creating objects from silhouettes, word lists and many have interactive areas to reveal extra places to search.

The world itself is generously interactive, and the quest designs are pretty logical and easy to work out. There was one point were I did get a little confused near the end and had to use a hint, because the item interaction was a little odd, but for the most part the game is fairly easy, perhaps a little too much so.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1517819950
Areas will be gated, meaning  at certain story intervals you won‚Äôt be able to return to previous areas. The plot does demand this, but it does mean searching for collectibles will take priority which can slow the pace of the game down. Perhaps not necessarily a bad thing considering it's not overly long anyway.

As in the previous game you‚Äôll be given a helpful assistant‚Ä¶ actually three, which will be available at different chapters in the game. Of these I found the most helpful to be the third, whose ability had two types of interactions, which made it a lot more fun to have around! Although the designers didn‚Äôt capitalize on the puzzle elements this could have included.

There is an option to set difficulty levels, but this mainly changes the amount if ingame hints you'll receive as well as how the game highlights the interactive areas. There's no gradation of puzzle difficulty by making them more complex or giving fewer starting hints.

[h1] Graphics[/h1]
[i]Song of the Dark Sun[/i] is incredibly beautiful. It‚Äôs magical environments lend themselves greatly to the atmosphere. From castle interiors to landscaped gardens and a fantastical forest, the environments are rich and detailed with little animations that lend a lively ambience to each scene.

The high production standards extend to the characters as well, who are beautifully painted, as though they had stepped from a piece of Renaissance art and their animations are much smoother, but sometimes do have odd facial motions.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1517820867
Most impressive was the fantastical creature designs‚Ä¶ in this the game does offer something truly unique. The small sprites have their own small ecosystem and enemies (and amusingly; is expanded on in the bonus content).
The animation and cut scenes were a little problematic still, the quality was much higher this time, but the transitions back to the gaming segments was awkward and jarring.

[h1] Audio[/h1]
The voice acting is immensely improved this time round! There‚Äôs far more expression and variation in tone, when each character speaks, and the casting is done really well, adding to the characterization of each person. 
One character did have some poor pronunciation: And spoke his ‚Äúg‚Äù sounds incorrectly as he kept using a hard g [g] instead of a soft g [d í]. This was mildly annoying but is a rare occurrence.
The music is melodic and whilst not as memorable as Stravinsky or Tchaikovsky, the orchestral pieces fit in thematically to the experience, and add a nice emotional colour to accompany the lush visuals.
Unfortunately, there is no music menu in the extras section with downloadable tracks, which other games offer. I was slightly disappointed by this as I usually retain a few tracks I particularly enjoyed after the game.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
[i]Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan[/i] is a very enjoyable HoG with a vibrant fantasy world, filled with magic and mystery. It‚Äôs a pure escape from the friction of reality for a few hours, in a competently created world. And whilst it may be formulaic, it is a formula that works incredibly well.

[h1]Score: 8/10 ~Excellent~[/h1]
[quote][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/7871885/]Please follow our curator page,[b] OCG Curations[/b] if you like and want to see more reviews like this one.[/url][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198413987657', 'num_games_owned': 3035, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1518621645}
review:
I love Hidden Object Games, but I hate their pricetags, so I generally recommend getting them in bundles. I'd also only recommend this if you like HOGs and puzzling, or you won't get much out of this (or any HOG for that matter).

The second of the Grim Legends series. However, you do not need to own or play the first game, as they function as separate titles. I definitely loved the visuals for that one, and the swan story rang a bell somewhere deep in my mind, so not all parts of the story were completely unexpected.

I do wish Artifex Mundi HOGs had a non-fullscreen option, but alas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002506911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 415, 'playtime_forever': 1162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1162, 'last_played': 1536127022}
review:
The Queen has been kidnapped by evil forces and the King and his mother are asking you to solve the mystery.  Typical Artifex Mundi style of gaming with a mixture of puzzles as well as hidden object games.  The storyline is mediocre, but better than most.  The puzzles weren't too difficult, though some did take a few tries to get to the answer.  The hidden objects, most were simple, but some were a bit ruthless in requiring you to pixel hunt for an object to move in order to find the hidden object in the scene.

The graphics and animation were better than what I've seen in the past and it's nice to see them progressing in their cinematics as well as overall art direction.  The music is nothing to truly speak of and the voice acting was mediocre at best, but fitting for such a game where storyline isn't truly the primary reason we're playing.  On the other hand the achievements are easily unlockable.

Definitely a fan of the Artifex Mundi style of games and this fits right into that.  I recommend playing it only if you enjoy a casual game, as it doesn't offer many thrills other than the reward of completing puzzles and hidden object scenes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198242337366', 'num_games_owned': 247, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1534285137}
review: Song of the Dark Swan was my favorite in the Grim Legends series. In it, you play as a healer hired to investigate why the Queen of a kingdom is mute. When the Queen is accused of using dark magic, it's up to you to prove her innocence before she's executed. Great story and lovely artwork. Highly recommended for fans of Hidden Object Games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063825413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 804, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1533850400}
review:

Es ist Teil 2 der Miniserie Grim Legends aka Grimmige Legenden ([url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198063825413/recommended/284850]hier Teil 1[/url]).

Der Point&Click-Anteil schien mir leicht unterhaltsamer geraten zu sein, daf√ºr fand ich die Geschichte uninteressanter (es war so sonnenklar was da abl√§uft) und das Helferlein (so eine Art Waldgeist) komisch.

Ein Minispiel war tats√§chlich identisch zu dem aus Teil 1, die anderen waren √§hnlich oder neu, aber fast alle einfach.

Wertung: 5/10

Etwas besser als der Vorg√§nger, aber letztlich das selbe.

Ich kann das Spiel daher nicht allgemein empfehlen, aber f√ºr die entsprechende Zielgruppe ein gutes Spiel ohne Macken.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201613371', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 309, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1533675930}
review:
Compared to The Forsaken Bride, The Dark Swan was much more enjoyable.
In The Song of The Dark Swan, you can get all the achievements in a single playthrough. (Unlike The Forsaken Bride.) For me, this is a huge plus and this HOG is quite difficult on expert mode. I sincerely recommend you follow a 100% completion guide on YouTube, or you‚Äôre going to be quite confused. 
The storyline was interesting, some of the characters are likeable enough. I didn't approve of the ending in chapter 1, but you will understand when you see it. 
Also most of the HOG's made sense, (Unlike The Forsaken Bride.) where you needed to do X to get Y and then Z, and it was much less frustrating as you didn't need to replay the entire story. 
Overall, I did enjoy it, but If I can help it I‚Äôm never going to be playing one of these again. If you are a fan of HOG's, or you want to try one, I really think you should give this one a shot. (But please, please, follow a guide if you have no intention of using hints.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198027686399', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1636168965}
review:
I've liked all the Grim Legends games. They all had pretty interesting stories, even if a bit predictable. They all start with a well-known Grimm fairy tale and then twist it around and play with it. This one is based on The Six Swans, and while it shares many elements and plays out in a similar way, it's not quite exactly the same.

The art style is cool, the puzzles are fun, you really can't go wrong buying this one. And the other two :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198041824954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1530744552}
review:
I had some doubts, but this is definitely a beautiful adventure game. If you're looking for a strictly hidden object game, there are only about a dozen over the course of the game and none of them take more than a minute to solve. It's very story-driven, and ends up as more a standard "gather and combine ojects" sort of point and click game. 

[h1] Pros: [/h1]
- Beautiful art and complex backgrounds
- Delightful music
- Reasonable story that closely follows the Brother's Grimm story of the six swans
- Simple puzzles and hidden object sections that are satisfying but not infuriating

[h1] Cons: [/h1]
- Freaking moon logic combinations that make no sense
- Voice acting is awful
- The faces of talking characters are 3D modeled and are both blurry and terrifying
- Excessive use of slider puzzles

[h1] Conclusions: [/h1]
- Thank the heavens for auto-hints after a certain amount of time, because without them I would surely have never figured out this game.
-Absolutely recommend if it's on sale. It took me about four hours, and even with the moon logic I had a great time and look forward to trying other games in the series. 
- Casual mode is your friend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092313524', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1526965321}
review:
Grim Legends: Song of the Dark Swan is the second of the series, where you play as a healer who has been summoned to Eagle Castle to see what she can do to heal the queen from her mysterious illness. But, of course, things take a sudden turn when you must now prove the queen's innocence before she is executed, which sends you on a dangerous and mystical quest. I finished the game (both the main game and bonus chapter) with all of the achievements in about five hours.

Overall I really enjoyed the game. The music, character and environment designs, puzzles, and story were entertaining and nicely done. The voice acting was mostly good, execpt for some sections that just sounded like the tone wasn't the most authentic. The kids in the game had heavy accents which isn't exactly a bad thing, but is something to point out for those who might be picky with that kind of thing (I personally thought it was charming). I loved the animal/spirit companions, and I didn't find myself stuck for quite as long as I had been with the first game. The only real issue I personally have with the game is that it feels a little short for its price.

I recommend this game with the other two of the trilogy in a bundle on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190380543', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 603, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1526907059}
review: Although this is a sequel to the first Grim Legends, it has nothing to do with it, at least story wise. What it has in common is the same with other Artifex Mundi titles, which is a point-and click adventure, with your standard exploration, object gathering and interacting, puzzle solving and finding objects in mini-games. This title is a bit simpler compared to it‚Äôs predecessor, being shorter and a bit easier. At least you can get all achievements in one playthrough of both the main story and its bonus adventure, which is another tale in the same setting. However, you get less content for the same price, and I personally preferred the previous title. Still, it‚Äôs a good game on sale and if you know what to expect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024311750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1523180277}
review: This is another really nice hidden object game. The fairytale-based story in Song of the Dark Swan is quite good and the artwork is lovely as usual. There are also three different "helpers" compared to the Forsaken Bride which just has the cat. This being my second game from Artifex Mundi I was able to play it through a bit quicker as the puzzles are very similar to the first Grim Legends and I knew exactly what to expect. I think they probably have the same basic formula with all of their games but this isn't a bad thing as they are a lot of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036328736', 'num_games_owned': 3959, 'num_reviews': 726, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1522657039}
review:
Excellent jeu d'objets cach√©s dans la continuit√© du premier √©pisode de la s√©rie Grim Legends.

Nous sommes une c√©l√®bre gu√©risseuse appel√©e par le roi d'un royaume lointain pour gu√©rir son √©pouse muette (voil√† pourtant une situation qui aurait ravi bien des maris, nest-ce pas?). Alors que nous nous appr√™tons √† lui prodiguer nos premiers soins, voil√† qu'une √©paisse fum√©e verte envahit la chambre de notre patiente et que le jeune enfant du couple royal est enlev√©. La reine est alors soup√ßonn√©e de pratiquer la magie noire et se retrouve au cachot.

L'histoire va conna√Ætre plusieurs rebondissements sur les th√®mes de l'amour, la vengeance et la mal√©diction au fur et √† mesure que nous allons d√©couvrir la pass√© des deux royaumes voisins. Et le sc√©nario va beaucoup parler de cygnes, inspir√© qu'il est par "Les six fr√®res cygnes" de Grimm mais aussi "Les cygnes sauvages " d'Andersen.

On retrouve ici les m√™mes principes de gameplay que dans le 1 et la qualit√© qui fait de la s√©rie parmi ce qui se fait de mieux dans le genre des jeux d'objets cach√©s. Les graphismes et la musique sont agr√©ables, les mini-jeux et les √©nigmes sont sympas bien que sans r√©elle difficult√© pour les habitu√©s du genre. Evidemment √ßa ne reste n√©anmoins qu'un jeu d'objets cach√©s qui reste loin de ce qu'on peut attendre d'un vrai bon point&click d'aventure mais ce titre saura satisfaire les joueurs qui veulent juste passer le temps sans que les moins perspicaces se retrouvent bloqu√©s par une trop grande difficult√©.


Il faut compter 5h pour terminer l'aventure principale et le bonus "Une princesse et un dragon", peut-√™tre un peu plus si on s'attache √† obtenir absolument le 100%.
Je recommande d'acheter le bundle de la trilogie compl√®te en profitant d'une p√©riode de soldes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971251537', 'num_games_owned': 993, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1518615762}
review:
Grimm Legends, right? These are certainly inspired by dark European fairy tales and folk lore. Yes, this is a Hidden Object Game, although there's not as much hidden objecting in these more recent Artifex Mundi games. I'd describe them as puzzle games with some point and click adventure mechanics and hidden object scenes thrown into the mix. These are my "end of the night, winding down" games, like a nice, hot cup of orange and cinnamon tea. The production values on this one are pretty good, although as per the genre the storyline is beyond cliched, and the voice acting ranges from scenery-chewing fun to hey-son-can-you-read-this-sentence-into-the-mic horrific. We're talking "so bad it's good" territory here. Which is not necessarily a bad thing.

It's longer than most HOGs, several hours for the main storyline, and then a couple of brief, bonus stories; more like end-credit scenes to be honest. Actually I probably enjoyed these little vignettes more than the main game, away from the horrible acting and stilted storytelling, the puzzles were logical and the setting a little less derived.

Overall, though, this is still one of the better ones, and if you've never played a HOG before this would be a fine introduction, but make sure you set it to Hard mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198234516860', 'num_games_owned': 495, 'num_reviews': 430, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1519439036}
review:
Good puzzle game.
I found it not quite as enjoyable as the first, but with slightly harder puzzles and a more complex storyline.
Definitely much more grim than the first.

Pros
- Beautiful art as always, nice music, pretty good voice acting, and no mispellings or confusing dialogue.
- No glitches or technical problems at all.
- The story line was fairly complex, even though at first it appears to follow a well known fairytale.
- The puzzles were a combination of relaxing and challenging. 
- The skip button has a 'recharge' feature meaning that you can't just skip through the entire game very quickly. You have to spend some time trying to complete the puzzle before it allows you to skip. I listed this as a pro, since it helps stop you from giving up in frustration, but it still allows you to skip if you still can't get it after a very short and reasonable amount of time.

Cons
- Some of the goals were unclear meaning sometimes you just went around clicking things but not really knowing what is needed to advance the plot.
- There were a lot of objects you could collect without knowing why you needed them. This only bothered me because why would a Healer/Doctor fix and carry a ladder around before they knew they needed one, instead of concentrating on the injured people? But this is mostly personal choice really.
- They removed the hidden object alternative game which they had in the first game. In this game your only option is to complete the hidden object scenes. Though they still have the hint button, so you shouldn't get too stuck on it, but it could still be frustrating for anyone who has extreme difficulty concentrating on busy scenes. (The first game allowed you to play a domino game instead, which was far less 'busy' to the eyes.)
- I was very shocked when I came across a dead body in this game. There don't seem to be any warnings about it. The game is not gruesome, but it definitely threw me out of the fairytale mindset quite abruptly, so be warned.

author: {'steamid': '76561198291784032', 'num_games_owned': 523, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1518265576}
review:
I am very new to HOG (Hidden Object Games) and just discovered Artifex Mundi.. 

But have played 8 games already! Really like what this studio comes up with!
Artifex Mundi has an amazing gift of creating new worlds in each of their games..

This is one of my favorites from the studio.
The challenges are quite straightforward, visuals are inviting.

Recommend this studio for anyone looking for casual games with good story and decent puzzles..

review: intrighi di palazzo, un erede al trono rapito, magia nera, l‚Äôeterna lotta tra il bene e il male, un oscuro segreto.. scopri il destino di due reami dimenticati.. rivivi la storia ke ha portato al declino il regno dei cigni attraverso i ricordi perduti del suo imperatore.. evoca il potere della natura e fatti aiutare dallo spirito dei boschi e da altri 3 inseparabili amici.. un‚Äôavvenuta grafica ben riuscita con atmosfere fantasy, un mondo ricco di rovine misteriose e boschi magici, ottima grafica e sonoro, trama articolata e ricca di colpi di scena.. avventura bonus eccezionale.. consigliato a tutti gli amanti del genere!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972040704', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 725, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1547996788}
review:
If you haven't played the prior game, Grim Legends: The Forsaken Bride, I would recommend playing it. You don't have to play it, because this game isn't truly a sequel to it in terms of storyline, characters, etc., but I felt that it was simply a better game, with more interesting puzzles and locations, at least for me. That said, Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan is still a very good Hidden Object Game (HOG). The puzzles are nice, it has lots of voice acting (albeit some is kinda awkward/meh), the story is okay (I thought the ending was really lame, though), the puzzles are pretty good, and the drawn 2D art is lovely. There are quite a few cutscenes with story, and the whole thing just looks lovely.

This game takes The Forsaken Bride's "companion" system (you got a cat you could use similarly to an item, repeatedly in that game), and expands on it to give you (I believe) three different companions you can use to solve a few puzzles. One thing I found strange: this HOG has the highest body count of any HOG I've played to date, though I am very new to the genre. By that, I mean it has the most characters actually die either on-screen or just a couple of screens away of any HOG I've played. I want to say 3 or 4 people die in the game. It didn't turn me off at all. These games are typically just rather squeamish about killing folks, and the fresh corpses were a brave choice that I enjoyed. Granted, thematically, it would have fit better in different HOGs that are darker in theme than this one, at least in my opinion.

After you complete the main story, a bonus story opens up, just like it does in The Forsaken Bride. However, while the bonus mission in The Forsaken Bride is a direct continuation and feels like it fits into the natural flow of the plot to some extent, Song of the Dark Swan's bonus mission felt to me like the devs/publishers said "Uh-oh, people will expect a bonus because the Forsaken Bride had one!" and cranked something out, even if it was just an oddball little plot that is irrelevant to the main game and does nothing to complement it in, at least for me. That said, it's a competently made bonus with some enjoyable puzzles and art, and I had a nice time with it for the most part.

I definitely recommend this game if you like HOGs. They all seem to be pretty much the same, except for how attractive they look and sound, as well as how user friendly (or not) they are, and Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan was as good or better than most of the HOGs I've been playing (still eager to play more fun ones). I'd recommend grabbing it for cheap in a bundle or on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095295470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1517060407}
review:
This one felt a little short, maybe I just got through it quicker I don't know. The scenery is beautiful and the main reason I play Artifex Mundi games. I really like how in this game the bottle glows to let you know whether you've missed the collectible or not, I'm always wondering in the other Artifex games where I've missed them and if any are present in some scenes.
I didn't really get submersed in to this game unlike the others, there were no characters to get attached to and the story was very predictable. The voice acting of the children was awful, I feel like they put the lines in to a robot like Google Translate? However as usual the character you play as has good voice acting.

Regardless of this being my least favourite Artifex Mundi game I would still recommend it purely for the scenery and how relaxing the game is.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982654131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1510872717}
review:
Somehow, this one didn't really "click" for me as much as Artifex Mundi's other games I have played. Can't really say why, the weird voice acting put me off a bit, and I didn't care all that much for the story. Still, a very solid AM release.

Also: The bonus chapter is supremely cute!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994971393', 'num_games_owned': 2927, 'num_reviews': 288, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1510083490}
review: Among the best HO games I've played. This publisher is no stranger to strong HO titles, but this one definitely stands out. Some new, interesting puzzles, a variety of HO types, and an expansion on the "cat" idea from Grim Legens 1. Also, the meta hidden objects are like the spirits from GL1, with none of the more obnoxious "elusive objects" to collect. Although be ready to hilariously fail as a healer: I've never seen more people die in a HO game than this one, where you are specifically supposed to save lives.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055712561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 578, 'last_played': 1495622569}
review: L'histoire est celle d'une gu√©risseuse qui arrive dans un ch√¢teau pour tenter de rendre la parole √† une reine muette. Tout se passe pas trop mal jusqu'√† ce que ... Voila pour un topo de base sans spoiler! Apr√®s, √ßa deviens difficile d'en parler sans raconter l'un des rares rebondissements. Pourtant, la force du jeu n'est pas la. Elle est dans les d√©cors, dans les SOC, dans la beaut√© des images, ... Cette sorte de douceur f√©erique est partout pendant une tr√®s grosse partie du jeu, ce qui en fait un tr√®s bel endroit de "balade" en rerun. Dans ce jeu aussi, on utilise les "compagnons", selon les environnements. L'histoire, si elle est "simpliste" n'en est pas pour le moins jolie, √©mouvante ... Pas de gros probl√®mes avec les √©nigmes, sauf celle des perles, et pas de probl√®mes de traduction.¬† Pour un jeu d'objet cach√©, √ßa manque un peu de SOC.¬† Tr√®s beau jeu et beau coup de c≈ìur pour moi.

review:
Ich bin ein gro√üer Freund, aber auch Kritiker, von diesen Spielen. 
Hier war die Grafik supi und die Gegenden wundersch√∂n. Die Minispiele sind wenigstens l√∂sbar, nicht wie in anderen Spielen.
Ebenso die Wimmelbildchen und es war mal wieder ein Spiel mit niedlichen Figuren, zauberhafter Story und wirklich ut gemachten Szenen.
Au√üerdem hatte ich es nicht nach einer Stunde durch, wie es mir bei dieser Art Spiel, oft geht.
Und das Bonusgame war auch ganz niedlich.
Danke f√ºr das Spiel ! ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561197961167133', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1504980201}
review:
Picked this up because I have a soft spot for these hidden object games and I am glad that I did. The puzzles were not too difficult but the game was still enjoyable to play. I played this on Linux using the open source Radeon drivers on Ubuntu 17.04 and had zero issues with the game. The story was decent and I found I wanted to learn more of it as the game progressed.


If you're into these casual Hidden Object Games this one is worth while to pick up and play through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198417943278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1514932023}
review:
2. parte de las leyendas deprimentes de Artifex. Con la historia de misterio habitual y los puzzles habituales de encontrar objetos. 

En comparacion con otros juegos de Arifex en este si que puede dar la sensacion de reiteracion en los mismos puzzles.

Aun asi para pasar una tarde esta bien.

Recomendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130262111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 261, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 581, 'last_played': 1506023899}
review:
Ha estado bien el videojuego de b√∫squeda de objetos. El nivel de los puzles ha sido un poco m√°s dif√≠cil, que el primer Grimm Legends. Posee una buena historia, y esta vez, mucho m√°s reducida y oscura, que ense√±ara a los m√°s ego√≠stas, que las mentiras tienen las patas muy cortas y que las malas decisiones, pueden pasarte factura con el tiempo, tanto a ti como a tus seres queridos.
Sigue sin gustarme, que desde el men√∫ que da acceso a los minijuegos de b√∫squeda de objetos, no podamos obtener logros. Todos los logros, solo se pueden conseguir, jugando el modo historia.
Tampoco me ha gustado, que parte de las secuencias de video, no est√©n disponibles, en el men√∫ de extras. Es una l√°stima.
Pero en definitiva, es un juego recomendable jugar, si te gustan de este estilo. Solo c√≥mpralo si lo encuentras por 1‚Ç¨, formando parte de un bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970282042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1504488559}
review:
I've played Enigmatis and Nightmares of the Deep. Every story has been fun. Especially NofD because it had Mahjong. Usually finish most of the puzzles by myself, but this one seems to have some really messed up puzzles. One you had some missing rectangle stone pieces, couldn't find them anywhere. Well, they were the round small stone pieces (2 of 2) that had collected earlier. Don't remember them doing this in any other game so far. There was at least one other puzzle that bothered my sanity like that.  So didn't enjoy the puzzles that much in this one, in Grim Legends 1 did. 

Really liked the story though, probably one of the best so far. 

Another note: this game uses Dominoes instead of Mahjong, so only did the HOS in here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031482193', 'num_games_owned': 1862, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1442670432}

author: {'steamid': '76561198379026622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1501401111}
review: I did NOT like this game.  Although the game itself was decent, I found one thing to be incredibly displeasing: ANIMALS DIE.  I'm an animal lover, so when I have to watch a beautiful white swan get viciously and bloodily killed by another swan, it rubs me the wrong way.  Yes, I know it's not real, but that doesn't mean I want to see it....ever.  You have to kill a fish with you otter, a rat gets scared away when he could have just been given cheese, and the lovely swan boat that you feed sweets to dies as well.  It's just a bit much for my liking.  I can play any hidden objects game and have an interesting story without having to murder animals.  I don't recommend this game at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080370930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1500922714}
review:
I bought this and number 3 in the sales after being suitably impressed by the first one, and I must say, I wasn't dissapointed.

Just as good as the first, with a nice fairytale/fantasy story line.

No major jumping about to complete quests, and fast travel is available via the map. Trading cards and acheivements as well.

Overall, a well constucted game, possibly worth full price.

Rating               90/100
Replay value      2/10 to complete acheivements
Play time          Approx. 5 hours

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197972271417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1499862782}
review:
This is one of the best reasons to get into HOPA. Stunning graphics coupled with an intriguing, if not too original, story makes it an ease and a blast to play. Though it's perhaps a bit light on hidden object scenes and more towards the fragmented object-type what is there is generally challenging without becoming tedious. The puzzles are also great with decent variety and some properly challenging ones that will force you to think rather than brute force your way through it. Bit lacking in the extras, would've especially liked to get the soundtrack since it was beautiful but that's just bonus stuff.

Artifex Mundi can definitely be uneven with the quality of the games they publish but this is definitely one of their best. If you're at all curious about HOPA or you need another fix, this is definitely one to get.

author: {'steamid': '76561198372064534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1509655143}
review: Again you have to deal enchated people who became swans instead of human being, as the title tells us. In the beginning you can't be sure, who is the good guy and who the bad, so the storyline gets interesting because you have to find out. As in the first part there are many minigames and point and click scenes and the graphic is perfect for a fairy tale. Personally, I liked part one more but I guess this is different for everyone. Who liked part one, will also like part two.

author: {'steamid': '76561198387507725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1533261247}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972822414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 412, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1496342359}
review: I‚Äôve played so many Artifex Mundi games now I have come to have a pretty good idea of what to expect and this lived up to my expectations. This is one of their more polished creations. Great artwork and hidden object scenes with solid puzzles connected together with a reasonable story. The only downsides were the voice actors for the children and there were more of the hidden object puzzles where you have to find items which match the pictures at the bottom of the screen as opposed to the ones where you find items off a list. But despite that if you like hidden object games this is well worth a play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968073802', 'num_games_owned': 381, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1496243329}
review:
As always Artifex Mundi doesn't disappoint with these click and point games. Always flawless play, a good and dramatic story with nice music and graphics. I am seeing some puzzles being used over again, but I'll guess that is fine. Recognizing them and understanding them isn't so bad. You know what you get when you play these games.

Some of the earlier games required you to complete the game more than once to get all achievements. I even had to play the first one in this serie a third time (did not complete the third time). All though the fact that I had to replay maybe 15 minutes of this game after completing it did not bother me.

I like these games, and how you proceed in them, but rushing on through the entire game to get some forgotten things is not that fun. Thumbs up that they made it this way!

review: At the moment, I only played this game for an hour. First of all, I thoroughly enjoy the puzzles and it's incredibly fun. However, there were a few times where I got extremely scared from "pop ups." One second, you'll be examining the game and looking for the next objectiv, and the next second, some guy pops out of no where and it just scares the fuck out of me. Anyway, I highly recommened playing this game if you're willing to use your teeny tiny brain and solve puzzles. Have a good day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043310378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1492309048}
review:
First of all, I would like to mention how I love Artifex Mundi's games.

This one was really interesting. The puzzles were tougher than I expected and it was quite a challenge ( especially in order to get all the achievements! ) 

I would've loved a story a little more detailed... It seemed like there was alot of elements and at some point I wasn't sure where all the chapters were leading me or it was really vague, leaving me confused...

Again, Artifex gives us beautiful graphic and drawings and this time the narration was much more better than other Artifex's games I played. I had a great time playing it and I recommend this to anybody who loves point and click games !

author: {'steamid': '76561197979693740', 'num_games_owned': 5710, 'num_reviews': 313, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1491768119}
review:
Much better than the first game, but still not up to my expectations when Mundi's name is on it.  While there are a few good HOGs in this title, they are few and far between.  Most of them are single-item hunts (e.g. find only feathers) which are far less enjoyable than the "find random crap on the screen" style puzzles, but admittedly that's just personal preference, and those ones do make an appearance albeit sparsely.

The story is nonsense, but I don't really think anyone plays these games for the story.  Suffice to say that doesn't have the standard "horror" element to it, so those who are typically put off by Mundi's cheap startle-scare thrills (always fun) will have nothing to worry about here.  Still, there's some stuff here that might give some kids nightmares (a little off-screen violence and the overall dark tone of the story) and some that might give adults nightmares (Mundi tradition of creepy animated children who talk funny).

On the plus side, it's a solid romp and none too difficult on expert difficulty, though you may find yourself stuck at times (protip: there's probably a HOG that has appeared on a previous room).  The extra hidden sigil quest is pretty easy this time around as you are notified when one is in the room you're in.  Also, there's no need to contend with mind-numbing alternatives to the HOGs (like mahjong when you suck at finding stuff) and therefore no need to play through the game again just to get them achievements.  Unfortunately, for those who -do- enjoy those minigames instead of solving the HOGs, you're out of luck here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122195567', 'num_games_owned': 466, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1601673494}
review:
First of all, this game has nothing to do with "Grim Legends 1", so it is a game where you don't have to play the first game to understand the story. However, the gameplay was very similiar and so I could finish the game faster than the first one.

Secondly, The story was interesting, especially it was unpredictable. Every time you thought you had understand what's happening, there was a sudden turn and then you were totally clueless as on the beginning. You really have to play the game until the end to understand the whole story.

The only bad point about the game is the too short ending. To be honest, I expected more like the ending of "Grim Legends 1" and not that kind of short and cheesy one. 

Last but not least, the bonus part was very funny and nice to play, [spoiler] even when it wasn't a proceeding or flashback of the main story. It was just a funny and short part where you could play a little longer in this world after you had finished the main one. [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198169876730', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1489240601}
review:
An enjoyable Hidden Object Game, but don't expect too much of it plot-wise. The story is very trite and made me roll my eyes several times. That said, the game is well constructed and the puzzles are fun enough, if you're looking for something easy.

I appreciated that this time I didn't have to go through the game twice to get all of the achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071375554', 'num_games_owned': 2813, 'num_reviews': 401, 'playtime_forever': 397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1488319532}
review:
I didn't enjoy it as much as the first game. The story was OK but the bonus chapter was really boring and unnecessary, doesn't add anything to the main game at all. The graphics however was good, but my issue is with the main character, how come she is a healer and does all of that? and why the king decided to depend on her instead of one of his many guards? 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=874431297

Pros:
+Beautiful graphics.
+Good music
+Good hidden objects scenes.
+Fast travel map.
+Nice diary/ journal, one of the best designs I've seen. 
+Collectibles
+Steam achievements.

Cons:
-No notes or journal entries, just the objectives and a map.
-Short game.
-Puzzles are very easy.
-illogical story.

I can still recommend it because it wasn't terribly bad although there are huge flaws in the plot [spoiler]How come the sorcerer/mistress of that king (The swans father) already have a child (the present king of the eagle land and who is married to the mute princess) does this mean she's been with the king of the other land and had a child with him then changed her mind and decided to love another king? it doesn't make sense at all, and clearly, her son is older than all the swans and the princess, so... I'm not sure if I get that part right.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198009393197', 'num_games_owned': 1835, 'num_reviews': 289, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1487330484}
review:
I got this game for free, and it's probably not worth full price unless you're a HOG fanatic and must own every game.

[u]The good[/u]

Above average music
Reasonable visuals
Tells a decent story even if it's nothing new
Game is fairly simple - easy to get a perfect game for those who care
Longer than most HOGs, decent value

[u]The bad[/u]

Cliched villains and situations
No surprises with the story
Minimal replay value
Puzzles aren't challenging
Dreadful voice acting

author: {'steamid': '76561198164151349', 'num_games_owned': 2681, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 1516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1516, 'last_played': 1483713105}
review:
[h1]Don't get your hopes high and you'll be ok[/h1]

Another HOG! I'd be lying if I said I didn't enjoy this one - [i]for the most part[/i]. 

[b]Story[/b] started out pretty interesting. There's a mystery to be solved and it involves a fair bit of drama. I enjoyed the narrative and where things were going... until the end. The conclusion - as with many other HOGs - was abrupt, rushed, stupid and illogical.

[b]Graphics[/b] are lovely. Touches of animation on each screen make the environments come alive, coupled with nice ambient sound/music.

[b]Music[/b] is pleasant and appropriate for each setting.

[b]Animation[/b] is very average and nothing to shout about, but will not take away from your enjoyment of the game. There are nicely done cutscenes every now and then as the story advances and you can play them back at any time from the main menu.

[b]Puzzles[/b] are mostly very easy, but contain a few of your standard slider types which were truly irritating. I didn't skip them because I am OCD about completing every puzzle I come across without any help, but wish I had because they are a real waste of time.

[b]Bonus content[/b] becomes available after you complete the game. The story is unrelated to the main game but complements it. It was pretty enjoyable with some good adventure puzzles.

[b]HOG component[/b] comprises finding fragmented objects mostly, though there are maybe 1 or 2 scenes that require finding whole ones. They're fairly easy and were quite fun because after assembling an object, you are required to use it in the scene itself.

[h1]Summary[/h1]
Aside from a weak ending, this was a lot more fun and interesting (story-wise) compared to many other HOGs. The narrative is compelling.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062558470', 'num_games_owned': 903, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1481471569}
review:
I bought Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan in a Bundle a while ago and I don't regret it. 

Before we Start the Review let me say that you don't have to play the first one as both of the stories are not related somehow and the main character seems to be different as well.

Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan is an amazing Point & Click / HO Game made by inhouse Artifex Mundi, the Artwork is great and the atmosphere amazing as always! However in this Title some of the Voice Actors where actually a bit awful to listen to.

This Game also comes with the Collectors Edition although it does not say so on Steam.

The Puzzles were mostly okay, challenging but not impossible. A few of the Puzzles however were absolutley stupidly difficult and I could not get passed them. But if you are good in Math you might find this hurd rather less annoying.

Although I had my difficutlies with this Game I still love its Story and its vibrant colourful Art Style.

I do recommend this game to people that are good in math or like mathmatic Puzzles. I also recommend this people to Achievement Hunters and to people that like HO / Point & Click Games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046407276', 'num_games_owned': 6090, 'num_reviews': 233, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1483055239}
review:
[h1]Artistic freedom in a Fairy Tale[/h1]

Type of Game: Hidden Object Game/Casual Adventure

Review in short: A good Hidden Object game, with a sympathetic story. A must buy for Fans of Fairy Tales, and Hidden Object afficinados.

Rating: 7.5 out of 10.

The story is a freeform of the Grimm Fairy Tale "The six swans". But instead of keeping too close to the story, which is quite familiar and actually exists in different versions (The twelve brothers, the seven ravens etc) it also uses freedom from the original, making it very interesting.

Artifex Mundi actually managed to catch the charm and the enchantment of the old fairy tale. The game is for younger people, and it's also aimed to a younger female audience. The game mechanics are, as with Hidden Object Games common easy to explain, and the tutorial could be easily put aside. The graphics are, again - as most of the time with Artifex Mundi - beautiful and enchanting. The riddles aren't always logical and more on a medium challenge level, yet they are perfectly integrated into the game and the story. The soundtrack also creates a good atmosphere. 

Recommendation: For Fans of Fairy Tales, Hidden-Object-Game, for younger audiences. 

[h1]Recommended[/h1]

Given the presentation and the game in general, it's a nice game to play - albeit it's short (all HOGs are short) it's worth the time invested into it.

review:
Bei Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan handelt es sich um ein gutes Wimmelbildspiel von Artifex Mundi.

Die Geschichte bedient sich inhaltlich am M√§rchenschatz der Gebr√ºder Grimm, wobei nicht stur an einem M√§rchen festgehalten wird.

Die Grafik ist gut, die Musik stimmig. Die animierten Zwischensequenzen treiben die Geschichte gut voran.

Die meisten R√§tsel sind im mittleren Schwierigkeitsgrad gut l√∂sbar. Ich musste nur ein paar wenige entnervt √ºberspringen.

Das Spiel hat mich gut unterhalten, ich w√ºrde es mir wieder kaufen. Einzig die fehlende deutsche Sprachausgabe tr√ºbt das Erlebnis ein wenig.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067370258', 'num_games_owned': 1040, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1467925930}
review:
Pro:
+ great graphics,
+ quite long for a HOG,

Con:
- some objects you need to find during HO scenes, look completely different, than the one actually placed in the game :D

It's the second installment of the "Grim Legends" HOG series, it doesn't live up to the first one, but it's still "okay". Story-wise, it's stand-alone. Buy it in a bundle, or during sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034414618', 'num_games_owned': 886, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1475598970}
review:
This is Artifex Mundi at their absolute most glorious. Lovers of lesser-known fairy tales will recognize the homage to "The Wild Swans" as the base of this, albeit with a chillingly dark turn. The villain is a bit predictable, but that's easy to forgive with all the effort, love and breathtaking artistry on display. The art style especially - for both the surroundings and the hidden object scenes is breathtaking. In former titles, character animation was a bit lackluster, but they really put all their heartsblood into it this time. Another plus: here is less confusing backtracking than with Artifex Mundi's other titles (that tended to drag them down) The mechanic of letting forest animals help you on your journey is a delight. Special mention also for the music, which is beautiful, calming and really puts you into a fairy tale mindset.

Bravo, Artifex Mundi. Bravo, bravo, bravo. You show us how HOGs are done. For any fan of HOGs, this is an absolute must. And if you're new to HOGs, this is a shining diamond of the genre.

review: A good second offering for the Grim Legends series.  The previous game was a bit longer, I felt, and the inventory a bit more engaging, but this is a good time waster too.  I always liked the fairy tale this one is based on, it's odd to present the story as a mystery if it's as well known as this one.

Dein Auftrag nimmt eine pl√∂tzliche und drastische Wendung, als der kleine Prinz unter mysteri√∂sen Umst√§nden verschwindet. Die K√∂nigin wird beschuldigt, dunkle Magie zu praktizieren, und in den Gef√§ngnisturm geworfen. Der verzweifelte K√∂nig, der an die Unschuld seiner Frau glaubt, fleht dich an, eine M√∂glichkeit zu finden, um die K√∂nigin zu entlasten. review:
Completato storia principale e aggiuntiva in circa 3 ore in totale.

Devo dire che questo gioco e questo secondo capitolo di Grim Legends non mi √® piaciuto per niente. Le storie a mio parere hanno lasciato un p√≤ a desiderare e in se ho trovato il tutto caotico per quanto riguarda la storia principale, semplice per la storia aggiuntiva e NOIOSO per entrambi.

Artifex ha abituato a titoli migliori come Nightmares From the Deep o Grim Legends.

Looking forward to playing the 3rd installment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032373667', 'num_games_owned': 540, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 667, 'last_played': 1473213432}
review:
Although this is the second [i]Grim Legends[/i] game, the story is not a sequel to [i]Grim Legends: The Forsaken Bride[/i] and can stand alone. The story is a retelling of a fairy tale with many variants where a sister must rescue her brothers from swan form by making shirts of nettles. Since I'm a sucker for fairy tale retellings, this automatically gave it plenty of credit in my eyes despite the overly expository intro.

As far as game mechanics are concerned, I really liked that they had a bottle that glowed if you hadn't found the collectible on that screen yet. I only wish that was a feature they had continued using in successive games. Instead of just one animal helper like in the first game, you had three helpers depending on location who make a noise to indicate when there's a task they can help with.

The music wasn't quite as good as the first game, but I did like how they used feathers instead of just sparkling to indicate hidden object scenes. Little details like that can really make a game.

There are several cute and unique minor characters that are surprisingly well-developed for such a short game. Some of these characters make appearances in both the main adventure as well as in the prequel bonus adventure.

Despite a couple of inevitable idiosyncratic moments, this is a quality hidden object puzzle adventure game that is well worth adding to your inventory.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041856540', 'num_games_owned': 919, 'num_reviews': 275, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1473031971}
review:
The production quality is excellent as customary for Artifex Mundi, but I simply can't recommend this game.

[h1]The good:[/h1]

+ Nice graphics (though the facial animations are weird)
+ Most HO scenes are especially beautiful, and look very congruent, not pieced together
+ Superb music and sound design
+ The genre's classic gameplay mechanics and controls
+ When carrying the baby, it appears on the bottom of the screen, adding realism

[h1]The bad:[/h1]

- This is the case where being bound by an original fairytale bites the game on the ankle, because this game has both the most confusing plot and the most over-swollen cast of characters of pretty much any HOPA game I've ever played.

I simply couldn't follow who is who, who did what, how are the 10? (or even more? I couldn't even figure out their full numbers) members of cast are related to each other. Many of them look very similar to each other, and barely 2 of them shows any notable personality.

- The children's voice acting was horrible.
- There were way too many companions. (This too might be due to the restriction imposed by the original plot, which the writers couldn't find a better workaround for.)
- The bonus story is weird and silly

[h1]Verdict:[/h1]
If you don't care about the plot at all, go for it, it looks/sounds pretty, and you probably know what to expect from an Artifex Mundi game in terms of gameplay.

On the other hand if you want to at least [i]understand[/i] what's going on, I'd say avoid this game, and pick another one from Artifex Mundi, say, [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/284850/]Grim Legends: The Forsaken Bride[/url] or [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/259740/]Nightmares from the Deep: The Cursed Heart[/url].

author: {'steamid': '76561198070689964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1527193411}
review:
La verdad es que este juego no es 100% redondo en su mecanica a la hora de interactuar con algunos objetos pero funciona bastante bien. Su historia esta bastante mejor contada que el anterior e incluso esta mucho m√°s nutrida de variedad y de elementos que la hacen m√°s llamativa e interesante pero podr√≠a estar un poco mejor en alguna que otra parte. 

Pros:

-Dise√±os geniales y variados que nos muestran castillos, bosques y lagos tipicos de una historia de fantasia.
-Una buena historia. Bastante mejor armada que su anterior y que si bien tiene esos t√≠picos elementos de la fantasia no empelada (no a mi por lo menos).
-Una buena ambientaci√≥n. Tanto su banda sonora, como sus entornos, voces y sonidos cumplen bastante bien su funci√≥n dentro de todo el juego.
-Un nivel de dificultad bastante interesante. Yo fui directamente por la m√°s dificil pero vi que tiene 3 dificultades diferentes.
-Una durabilidad m√°s que aceptable. No se esactamente cuanto me llevo terminarlo pero en las casi 11 horas que sumo termine 2 veces la historia principal y una vez la historia extra.
-Un buen pu√±ado de logros.

Contras:
-Errores de traduccion. Algunos de estos llevan un poco a la confusi√≥n a la hora de hacer busquedas y otros confunden un poco al seguir el hilo de la historia.

En resumen Song of the Dark Swan tiene una historia interesante, buenos dise√±os y una buena dificultad... Podr√≠a no tener esos pocos errores de traducci√≥n pero en su totalidad esta todo bastante bien.

/////¬°SPOILER!/////

Y esta historia nos recuerda al viejo y conocido saber popular de que las suegras son unas viejas brujas :V solo que esta lo lleva a otro nivel.

/////¬°SPOILER!/////

Der einzigste Nachteil besteht in dem Preis Spielzeitverh√§ltnis.
Weil 8 Euro f√ºr 10 Spielstunden finde ich etwas √ºberzogen.

Zusammengefa√üt gebe ich dennoch "Grim Legends 2"
ganz klar einen Daumen nach oben und empfehle es weiter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198197896761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1468397307}
review:
In this HOG u will be taking the role of the healer. During ur adventures u have to find out why the queen has not spoken a word in a long time. While trying to help her crazy things happen and u have to also find a way to prove the young queens innocence. You will also be trying to break a curse while helping the queen.

The art, music, and bg are all very nice. The voice acting was not the best, but not the worst either.

Also this time three friends will join u in different parts of the story. In the first one only one joined u the whole story.

I really wish the bonus story was longer. I had fun playing the bonus story and I also love Dragons a lot:) 

I'll be honest I really liked the first game compaired to this. This Grim Legend doesn't continue from the first one. As someone said below that there wasn't that much HO also.

Honestly major complaint I have is that this is really a standalone title and have nothing to do with the first Grim Legend.

Besides that one small complaint I still enjoyed playing this HOG and recommened to play this HOG:) I also got thos on a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028216179', 'num_games_owned': 2423, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 980, 'last_played': 1465964125}
review:
[i]Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan[/i] is the second installment in the [i]Grim Legends[/i] game series, it has no connection to the first title however. In this game you play a world famous healer brought to the Eagle Kingdom to tend to the beautiful queen. What starts off as a simple visit turns into an epic adventure battling dark magic and an evil curse. The fate of two kingdoms -and the lives of their denizens- lay in your hands. This game is filled with interesting twists and turns as well great gameplay, making a very enjoyable experience for fans of hidden object games.

You take the role of the famous healer brought to a majestic castle, you begin your job tending to the queen and everything is going well until the young prince is kidnapped and the queen is accused of practicing black magic. This offense is punishable by death and she is taken to jail. Her king is distraught and tasks you with the job of proving her innocence. Soon you‚Äôre dragged into a world of magic, curses and death as you race to find the prince and save his mother. Despite the title mentioning a ‚Äúdark swan‚Äù this doesn‚Äôt play too big of a role in the story, mainly confined to the first half, which I found disappointing. The story is also rather predictable and not very interesting. I found the story of the Swan Kingdom, where the queen is from, to be the most alluring. It‚Äôs told via flashbacks and explains why the kingdom fell under a curse.

To play the game you use your mouse to interact with people and objects as well as move around. You also collect useful items and tools that you need to progress in the game.The main crux of the game are hidden object scenes where you are given a written list of items to find in the scene. There also some scenes where the list is presented as pictures of items to find. I felt that the game could have used more hidden object scenes, I also felt that the scenes could have been a bit more complex- such as requiring you to perform a few different steps to find an item, like move a piece of paper aside or paint a feather red. There are also puzzles in the game, they‚Äôre not too difficult but some do offer a challenge. One note, you play a healer in the game so I expected potion-making to be a larger part of the gameplay. While it did factor in more than usual hidden object titles I felt it was under-utilized.

Graphics-wise the game is beautiful. Lovely colors and artwork help keep the feel of the fairy tale land you‚Äôre exploring. The hidden object scenes are very well done with the items not being too small that it would hurt your eyes. The character models are very well done though movements can be a bit stiff. The game has full voice acting which is well done, though some of the younger characters can sound a bit annoying and their acting is off, but this is a minor issue. Music in the game is lovely and fits the tone of the story and all of the sound effects are also spot on.

Overall I do recommend [i]Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan[/i] as an addition to your library. While not as stand out as the first title in the series, it‚Äôs still a solid gaming experience. There are Steam cards and achievements as well as collectable items to find during your playthrough. There is also a bonus chapter which is very adorable and also gives a nice side story about the queen. You have three cute sidekicks to help on your adventure which adds a bit of levity to the story, however, I did find the ending anticlimactic. All complaints aside, this is a good game, it‚Äôs fun to play and I recommend grabbing it when you can.

[url=http://lunarproductions.tumblr.com/]Lunar Productions[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198045141591', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1465396582}
review:
Grim Legends 2: Song og the Dark Swan is much like the first one a cute point and click adventure game. And I will recommend them for anyone that want to experience the old kind of folk narratives, as that is what the story reminds me of the most. (Fairy Tales, Moral stories, legends.) While the game plays and feel mostly the same, I think it is an improvement from the first one.

The game is in first person, but unlike the first game it doesn't really bother me so much here. Since the protagonist is known as the "healer" and doesn't have a preexisting relationship with any of the characters, so while her profession is given she is pretty much a blank slate. (Personally still prefer most games in third person, but unlike the first game, I think the first person works here.)

The story is easy to follow and the puzzles are mostly enjoyable. This time the story fits the slower puzzle solving gameplay better than the first one, as the threats to the characters aren't presented to be as immediate as they were in the first game. So it makes sense that you work slowly to uncover the story. It is more the: ‚ÄúWe need this done as soon as possible!‚Äù As opposed to some moments of the first one: ‚ÄúWe need to do this NOW or we will die!‚Äù

The characters are easily identifiable and not very complex, but that fits well with the genre of story that is told in the game. As it is more about telling an enchanting tale, rather than how the characters experience the events. So you will be most likely able to guess who the evil one is before it is revealed just from clich√©s in old stories, but the story is still cute and charming. I won‚Äôt replay it, but I don‚Äôt regret buying or playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052965201', 'num_games_owned': 1046, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1526656520}
review: Second installment of the Grim Legends series and it takes a more lighthearted, fairy-tale approach than the first one. No demon wizards and transmogrified princes, but an evil queen-mother, a heroic kind king and a mute cursed queen. A story guided along by the solving of puzzles, some of which are kind of confusing and obtuse, but nothing insurmountable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129680513', 'num_games_owned': 802, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1464340985}
review:
As expected from Artifex Mundi hidden object games.

The story is pretty well told in the game. Nice story telling.

There are tons of mini games too.

There are new (for me) hidden object mechanism where we have to find an object and use it right away to unlock another objects. Pretty fun :D

Easy achievements and all can be unlocked just by 1 play through, unlike Nightmares from the Deep: The Cursed Heart which for 100% achievements, we have to beat the game at least twice.
I used community guide for achievement "Find all Healer's Sigils". It tells you the location with pictures of them.
And I tried to unlock "Finish HO in less than 30 seconds." by first HO scene. Restarted it for about 4 times until I got it, and the rest are very easy.

And it has trading cards.

review: Artifex Mundi makes the best hidden object games, and Song of the Dark Swan has been one of my favorites. I really enjoyed this take on The Six Swans fairy tale, and the art was lovely as always. The weakest link is always the voice acting, and some of it is fine while some of it is cringeworthy. If you like HOGs, you really can't go wrong with an Artifex Mundi title. Can't wait for Grim Legends 3!

review:
[h1] Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan (Ïñ¥ÎëêÏö¥ Ï†ÑÏÑ§ 2 : Í≤ÄÏùÄÎ∞±Ï°∞Ïùò ÎÖ∏Îûò)[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198159803667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 811, 'last_played': 1482993734}
review:
This is my first game from Artifex Mundi series. It was recommended by a friend of when she saw me playing a similar type of game. So I try and choose this "Grim Legends" Series. I fond of this particular fairytale.

The game is well-made and such beautiful artwork/graphics. The story can be follow easily as you progress in the game. You can used a map to go to a particular area fast, although I prefer to walk along the area for clues. The puzzles are quite interesting and it sometimes provide "depth" to our character (As a healer/herbalist) and to the story. The bgm are really good make you relax and concentrate on solving the puzzle.

Everything is great but the voice acting... just little bit off but you can ignore it. When you listen there will be few dialogue that are "Being READ by the voice actor" not "ACTING on it" a way.

Anyway, I do recommend this for those who are into fairytales and puzzle solver. Worth for your time and mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198194289627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1668503870}
review:
As usual for this publisher: lovely music, graphics, and locales. The voice-overs and story coherence were above par, IMO (though it's clear from the beginning who the villain is). The puzzles seemed to get more annoying later in the game, but i'm not really a puzzle person, and that's what the Skip button is for :-D. i found myself needing a Hint on how to continue now and then, unfortunately, but that's my problem, not the game's.

Down-side: other than being short (finished it in under 4 hours), none. There were a few "what the HELL just happened?" moments for me (specifically, the tree with the acorn in its mouth, the arrow stuck in a tree, and collecting the evil snail's slime).

HO scenes: they are overall quite easy, but many of them follow the pattern which is seemingly more common in games from Big Fish: the items collected in such scene combine to build up the item you end up getting after the scene. (i prefer this approach over searching for many random items and keeping one of them afterwards.) Some reviewers complain about the abstract shapes of some of the HO items, but that's clearly a matter of taste. Yes, they DO make the HO scenes more difficult, but that's not necessarily a bad thing. Ambiguous search terms in HO scenes are relatively common (e.g. looking for a "face" when there are at least 3 faces in the scene), but i've seen much worse.

Good pacing, though, combined with nice voices and lovely scenery, make this a nice casual HOPA.

Gotta thumb this up.

review:
- This review isn't written by a native speaker, thank you for your understanding -

- If you haven't found this review helpful or if you have found a mistake please leave a comment below -

[h1][b]Rating[/b][/h1] Must Play !

[h1]- Key features below ---- Review after -----------------------------------------------[/h1]

[h1][b]Play time needed (perfect)[/b][/h1] about 4 hours
[h1][b]Gaming level[/b][/h1] Casual
[h1][b]Achievement level[/b][/h1] Casual
[h1][b]Game style[/b][/h1] Hidden object; Puzzle; Point n' Click (First person view)
[h1][b]Game modes[/b][/h1] Story mode, Bonus story mode
[h1][b]Graphics[/b][/h1] Very good !
[h1][b]Story[/b][/h1] Very good.
[h1][b]Playthrough[/b][/h1] One.
[h1][b]Voice[/b][/h1] Very good.
[h1][b]Music[/b][/h1] Very good.
[h1][b]Controls[/b][/h1] Mouse only.
[h1][b]Tutorial[/b][/h1] Yes.
[h1][b]Unmissable / backtracking content[/b][/h1] No, refer to (*) at the end.
[h1][b]Glitches / bugs[/b][/h1] None.
[h1][b]Worth price[/b][/h1] Full price if you accept the (*) point at the end and its length..

[h1]- Review below ----------------------------------------------------------------------[/h1]

Artifex Mundi sp. z o.o. is one of the best Puzzle/Hidden Objects developer I've found so far !

You may think like me that "Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan" can be the sequel of the first game Grim Legends: The Forsaken Bride. But the story is really independent, the only link between them is that each of them relate a grim legend.

The story is very good and graphics are awesome. The puzzles and hidden objects scenes are fairly shared.

The game features an inventory where you can store items to combine with the environment to go deeper in the story. In the game you will also find several animal fellows and one spirit that will help you through your adventure.

The game have several difficulties and have a guest feature : all the family can play the game and resume it where they left. There is also a map which is useful to fast travel through the different places and that can have some hints if you play in an easier mode. Also you can use the Hint/Skip hourglass whenever you want and wait until its refill to use it again. But be warned that you may not skip or use a hint in any puzzle or hidden objects scene if you wish to have some achievements. It's also the case for not skipping the first ten cut scenes while playing the story.

There is a wide choice of puzzles and there are two kind of Hidden objects scenes. The first Hidden objects scene features the name of the objects to find some are found easily (normal one) and some others need you to interact with the environment or to combine two items to found them. The second Hidden objects scene let you find the shape of the objects in the scene and sometimes ask you to use them in order to obtain the others.

(*) :
The game has some achievements that can be missed even some collectibles related achievements and also some challenging achievements including finishing the game on hard mode. There is a guide on steam that will help you to not miss any of these achievements. The challenging achievements require you to finish a puzzle or an hidden objects scene or a domino game under a minute. And two achievements require you to find 3 objects in 3 seconds or find all objects without any misclick in the hidden object scenes.
