author: {'steamid': '76561198033995360', 'num_games_owned': 2161, 'num_reviews': 441, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1459414786}
review:
Song of the dark swan est l'un des plus ravissants bijoux du catalogue Artifex Mundi, un diamant qui s'est invit√© dans un collier de perles. Cette gentille relecture du conte des six cygnes r√©hausse les sommets de beaut√© d√©j√† gravis dans les jeux pr√©c√©dents. Son monde de fables, de dragons et de rois a pris forme par un superbe trait de pinceau. On se r√©gale de chacun des tableaux dans lesquels on progresse ; y fouiller des ficelles ou des fleurs nich√©es dans l'ombre d'un ventre de troll qui se dore le bourrelet au soleil, d√©jouer les vices des jeux de couleurs et de lumi√®re, ramasser la figurine cach√©e dans les armoiries d'un bouclier allong√© au pied des restes d'un soldat peut-√™tre tomb√© pour une lointaine bataille, scruter, s'approcher, tripoter les environnements est un plaisir. Un plaisir jamais g√™n√© par des sentiments moins simples, Grim Legends 2 √©tant situ√© vers le fond de la moiti√© basse des jeux d'objets cach√©s difficiles. On y passe le gros de son temps √† r√©soudre des √©nigmes et √† vaincre les mini-jeux habituels ; eux non plus ne devraient pas vous voler trop de minutes m√™me avec trois grammes de Bordeaux dans le sang.

Song of the dark swan profite de toute l'exp√©rience amass√©e par les HOG pr√©c√©dents. Partout autour du curseur, le confort moderne. Son interface est claire et √©l√©gante, le rythme parfaitement dos√©, la narration n'est ni trop discr√®te ni trop pr√©sente, enfin les t√©l√©portations d'une zone √† l'autre nous simplifient la vie m√™me s'il serait dommage de ne pas lambiner un peu dans de si beaux jardins. Les musiques, assez charmantes pour qu'on les remarque, participent √† l'ambiance g√©n√©rale et √† ses bienfaits. Un zeste de cruaut√© coule sur les bosses d'une histoire na√Øve et tendre, celle des amours interdits et des cr√©atures √©tranges, d'un √©lan intr√©pide mais finalement sans danger qu'on regarde depuis l'autre bout du m√™me prisme f√©minin que celui √† travers lequel on regardait la Caverne de la Rose d'or. 

Plus ambitieux que beaucoup d'autres, p√©tri de qualit√©s et de raisons de se promener avec sa main dans le chaud de la sienne, Song of the dark swan sera aux habitu√©s ce qu'un psaume est aux fid√®les, mais aussi une fen√™tre ouverte √† l'intention des curieux et des d√©butants. Au-del√†, il risque de semer des coeurs d√©√ßus. Le jeu d'objets cach√©s, encore plus quand il est pens√© pour un parterre de novices, est promis √† ne jamais d√©passer les ma√Ætres du jeu d'aventure ; les pieds enracin√©s dans des m√©canismes redondants, prisonnier d'un public qui se d√©core le bras de sacs √† main, il tra√Æne son corps sur la Terre le menton lev√© vers en haut, l'oeil r√™veur, ambitieux mais incapable de voir ce qu'il y a de l'autre c√¥t√© du plafond de verre. Toujours malade des m√™mes carences, banni du jardin d'Eden, il ne se r√©signe pourtant pas, ne se satisfait jamais de sa condition. Alors il travaille, progresse et, s'il n'aura jamais d'ailes, pierre apr√®s pierre, il b√¢tit l'escalier de sa tour de Babel.

L'objet cach√© atteint enfin sa maturit√© et, en d√©posant dans nos m√©moires des aventures telles que celles des Grim Legends, il continue de grandir et de m√©riter de baiser les pieds des plus grands que lui. Malgr√© ses limites inh√©rentes √† son genre, Song of the dark swan nous laisse entrevoir des choses magnifiques, cultive l'art de nous offrir tellement avec si peu, en exemple d'un voyage vers des destinations de luxe mais en classe hyper √©conomique, √† bord d'un vieux coucou √† p√©dales qui survole la fronti√®re russo-turque en p√©riode de tensions diplomatiques. √Ä l'int√©rieur, tout le monde se bouscule, se frappe, et vas-y que je te mette un coup de boule, pas de piti√© pour les vieilles et les enfants, pour s'asseoir au plus pr√®s du hublot. Car de l'autre c√¥t√©, mille merveilles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139328230', 'num_games_owned': 2324, 'num_reviews': 260, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1458155420}
review:
[i]Grim Legends[/i] has easily become one of my favorite Artifex Mundi series, with a theme centering around Brothers Grimm Fairytale collection. Each new game is an original and beautiful interpretation of one of their collected European fairytales. Thus, there is no story consistency between games in the series. You can pick and enjoy them as stand-alones. Being a lovely interpretation of [i]The Six Swans[/i] story, [i]Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan[/i] is no different.

Here, we take the role of a healer, brought in to the Eagle Kingdom to find a solution to the young and beautiful Queen's unknown ailment. She has never spoken a word for the years that she has passed with her beloved King; not even after the birth of their son. According to Queen Mother - the Peacock Lady - all she ever does is weaving shirts out of nettle without ever resting. As we just start to examine the young Queen, a sinister green smoke breaks into her chamber, engulfing her and the heir. When the smoke is gone, so is the heir. The Peacock Lady steadily accuses the Young Queen with witchcraft - punishable by burning at the stake as the laws of the land dictate. Suspicious of this accusation, the King pleads with us to find a way to prove her innocence. So, our journey towards the Swan Kingdom - the homeland of the Queen - in hopes of finding proof of her innocence begins. We are to learn of an old tragedy, unmask the real villain and break a curse while we are at it.

Maybe not as dramatic or impressive as the first game, [i]Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan[/i] is still a beautiful interpretation of the original tale and a well-made addition to the series. Artworks are trademark Artifex Mundi at this point: vibrant, appealing and picturesque. Character designs themselves are quite fitting for the tale, with thriving animations, mimics and color choices. Voice acting is not spectacular, but still well above average. Whenever I write about one of these HOGs hailing from Artifex Mundi, I feel like working on a paying advertisement; but I swear that's not the case. Their work in these silly casual games is nearly always that good, that's all.

Gameplay though, is a bit sterile in this one compared to other Artifex Mundi games. We don't have as many HOG scenes as we'd expect. The game is dominated by FROG - Fragmented Object Games - where you are expected to collect pieces of a certain item to make a whole, then use as a part of another item combination. Puzzles are fine - nothing shallow or suicidal, just the right amount of brain scratching, if not a bit basic. Compared to other titles, there is a fair amount of backtracking too, so be ready to recall details from past environments if you are playing in expert difficulty. There is domino or mahjong alternative gameplay here, since there isn't much HOG scenes to alternate between anyhow so one playthrough would be suffice for collecting all achievements.

By the end, this second instalment in the series, is a beautiful game appropriate for a lazy midweek afternoon. Grab it on sale and admire some beautiful artwork accompanied by a neat selection of puzzles and an enchanting retelling of a Grimm Brothers story.

Please also check out Lady Storyteller's Curator page [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/ladystoryteller#curation]here[/url] - follow for regular updates on reviews for other games!

author: {'steamid': '76561198277011659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1457803257}
review:
The Sequal to Grim of Legends didn't disappoint me, but it didn't wow me either. The negatives are still there: voice acting, which is even worse in this. Especially the young brothers toward the end. Then we have the story, which in general isn't bad, but in a puzzle game, with some hard puzzles, they still spell everything out that you pretty much knew an hour ago. 
And this was for me more than 2h shorter than the first one, which may not seem like much, and it's probably a good thing, but I wanted more.

The artwork is still great, same with puzzles. Music and sound is still essential to game in a good way. It's a decent sequal, just not as good as the first one. 6.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198101342452', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1457283018}
review:
[b]Spielwertung:[/b] 8/10

[b]Spieldauer:[/b] ca. 5 Stunden inkl. Bonuskapitel (Schwierigkeitsgrad: Experte)

+ sch√∂ne Grafik
+ gute Musik und Soundeffekte
+ gute aber leicht d√ºstere Geschichte
+ leicht erreichbare Errungenschaften; im ersten Durchgang 100 % m√∂glich
+ Bonuskapitel (ca. 1 Stunde)
+ sehr belebt wirkende Szenen, durch huschende Insekten, fliegende Bl√§tter etc. 
+ Schnellreisefunktion per Karte
+ Sammelkarten

- Textbalken im oberen Bereich sind sehr gro√ü
- kleinere Text- u. √úbersetzungsfehler

[b]Zusammenfassung/Kommentar: [/b]

Nach dem ich Grim Legends: The Forsaken Bride gespielt habe, musste ich unbedingt den zweiten Teil spielen. Ich muss gestehen, dass ich nicht erwartet habe, dass er den ersten Teil √ºbertrifft. Tats√§chlich bin ich ein wenig zwiegespalten. Ich fand die Geschichte hier besser aber das Gameplay, besonders wenn ich mir die Wimmelbilder anschaue, schlechter. 

Grafisch braucht sich das Spiel nicht hinter seinem Vorg√§nger zu verstecken. Auch wenn die Hintergr√ºnde etwas anders gezeichnet sind. Sie wirken etwas weniger m√§rchenhaft-mystisch sind aber dennoch sehr sch√∂n anzusehen. 
Was mir besonders positiv aufgefallen ist, dass die Szenen belebt wirken. Einerseits sorgen die Hintergrundger√§usche daf√ºr und andererseits huscht immer mal etwas durchs Bild. Eine kleine Libelle, die hin und her fliegt, Bl√§tter, die vom Wind davon geweht werden. (Das passiert auch in den Wimmelbildszenen, wo es vielleicht, als st√∂rend empfunden werden k√∂nnte.)

Die Geschichte wurde angelehnt an ‚ÄûDie sieben Raben‚Äú von den Gebr√ºdern Grimm. Sie √§hnelt dabei aber mehr einer verfilmten Variante von 1993 und weniger dem Originalm√§rchen. 
Ich betone aber angelehnt; das Spiel bringt durchaus noch eigene Ideen mit. Inzwischen habe ich schon einige Wimmelbildspiele gespielt. Viele von ihnen haben versucht mich zu ber√ºhren, zu gruseln, erschrecken. Und das auf mannigfaltige Art und Weise und nur den Wenigsten ist es gelungen. 
Grim Legends 2 hat es geschafft. Schlie√ülich sa√ü ich vorm Bildschirm: ‚ÄûWas macht das Spiel mit mir? Das ist doch nur ein Wimmelbildspiel!‚Äú
Ohne viel spoilern zu wollen: In dem Spiel sterben ein paar Nebenfiguren. Und obwohl man diese nicht gekannt hat, hat es mich ber√ºhrt. Immerhin haben sie teilweise versucht uns zu besch√ºtzen. 

Ich habe in meiner Einleitung gesagt, dass mir die Wimmelbilder nicht so gut gefallen haben. Warum das? Ganz einfach ich mag die Art der Wimmelbilder, die zu einem Gro√üteil verwendet wurden, nicht. Positiv zu erw√§hnen ist aber, dass man nur zwei bis drei Wimmelbilder doppelt absucht. Ganz wenige Wimmelbilder sind nach dem herk√∂mmlichen Prinzip, dass man ein Wort hat und dann den Gegenstand sucht. Bei vielen sind die Umrisse der gesuchten Gegenst√§nde angezeigt und andere sind nach dem Prinzip: ‚ÄûSuche X-mal Gegendstand X‚Äú (Beispiel: 10x Kr√§uter suchen)
Gut gemachte Wimmelbilder dieser Art k√∂nnen schwieriger sein, als die G√§ngigen (so empfinde ich das jedenfalls). Aber h√§ufig waren diese nicht herausfordernder. Schnell der Reihe nach alles Verd√§chtige angeklickt und man lag meist richtig. Gelegentlich galt es noch etwas zu verschieben. Errungenschaft: ‚ÄûEine Wimmelbildszene in weniger als 30 Sekunden l√∂sen‚Äú war keine Herausforderung mehr. Mit der Zeit wurde das etwas √∂de. Gelegentlich reagierten gesuchte Gegenst√§nde etwas beh√§big. In einer Szene musste ich fast 4 Mal auf ein Zahnrad klicken, bis sich etwas tat.  
F√ºr ein Wimmelbildspiel gibt es auch ‚Äûrelativ‚Äú wenig Wimmelbildszenen (WBS: 17; R√§tsel: 23). 

Die R√§tsel waren alle gut l√∂sbar. Mal hin und wieder eins das schwieriger war. Aber es sollten keine wirklich schwierigen dabei sein. Wie immer bei Artifex-Mundi-Spielen einige der R√§tsel kommen einen bekannt vor. Es wurden neuere eingef√ºhrt, allerdings wurden diese auch in anderen neuen Spielen von AM eingef√ºhrt, sodass sie einen wieder bekannt vorkommen. 

Und wieder haben mich die Textbalken gest√∂rt. Sie sind sehr gro√ü und verdecken damit einen Teil des oberen Bereichs. Beim absuchen von Szenen leicht st√∂rend. 

Dennoch ist Grim Legends 2 ein tolles Spiel. Es hat kleinere Macken, aber die kann man verkraften, da es so einiges richtig macht.  

[b][i]Fazit:[/i][/b] Grim Legends: Song of the Dark Swan ist ein gutes Wimmelbildspiel mit einer guten Geschichte und sch√∂nen Bildern. Auch wenn es ein klein wenig schw√§cher ist, wie der Erste Teil, lohnt sich ein Kauf. Vorkenntnisse vom ersten Teil werden nicht ben√∂tigt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258151287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1652741808}
review:
I have played quite few HOGs and Artifex Mundi is still one of the best HOG developers. They can make any basic story sound interesting with good storytelling, having few plot twists, good puzzles and with really amazing background art. The pros of their games is making the most simple stories interesting and memorable but always having a high quality in their games. The cons are that these games are like Undertale; you get the most fun and delight when you don't know anything about it. Later on it's nice to replay it few times but it doesn't have the same charm anymore. But this game has something that just makes it better when you replay it few times. I played this game twice and the story made lots of more sense. 
This game isn't sequel to earlier Grim Legends-game, the Forsaken bride; it's just an another tale and another story in distant country far away. 
The story is quite decent for HOG game; something bad happens and player has to solve the problem and also seek the truth which lead to horrific events. Basic day. But Artifex Mundi gives live to this story with intriguing backstory which in my opinion sounded realistic. 
The puzzles are not hard but they might take time depending, how accustomed HOG player you're. 
The voice acting is good too, quite good for HOG game. The voices have personality and I have to admit that I still remember clearly the nasal voice of the Peacock queen [spoiler]and the rough and hoarse voice of the Swan king[/spoiler]. 
The art has personality and looks nicely rough and the background looks slightly twisted in my opinion, contrast to the bright colors and prettiness. It makes the game more memorable but also gives the feeling that the world is alive and breathing when our protagonist is on the adventure.The music also is really pretty but not something that really stays in mind.
There's a main game but also a bonus game but the main games story is much more well thought than the bonus. It just gave me the feeling that Artifex Mundi had to add some kind of bonus story so the CE wouldn't feel waste for the buyers. But it is still enjoyable if you don't think it too much. [spoiler]And personally I would have liked to that bonus was small prequel or sequel of the main story than another story in Swan queens perspective.[/spoiler]   

It's good game with basic story where you solve the mystery of mysterious events. It's one of the best Artifex Mundi games they have made for awhile and for it's high quality in art, story and possible the collectibles you can say that you haven't wasted you money in vain. If you're still thinking should you buy this use your extra money to it when you wan't to just sit down and have fun or buy it when it's on sale. This game is a good introduction on the Hidden object genre and on the Artifex Mundi games.

The pros: 
- gorgeous art
- basic story with an twist 
- memorable voice acting 
- realistic characters      
- replay possibility

The cons: 
- needs more than one play through to enjoy properly 
- slightly linear story 
- predictable

review: No esperaba nada de nada de este juego, creo que sali√≥ de alg√∫n bundle, pero en una √©poca que estaba enfermo, me puse a jugarlo (por el hecho de hacer click por todos lados sin tener que pensar demasiado) y la pas√© bastante bien hasta terminarlo, e incluso me llegue a plantear comprar m√°s juegos de esta gente, cosa que no hice y no creo que haga por el momento.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083840190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 917, 'last_played': 1453008086}
review:
La verdad que yo no soy muy fan de las aventuras gr√°ficas pero tengo que decir que √©sta logro entretenerme, me gust√≥ la historia, muy lindos puzzles, algunos mas dif√≠ciles que otros, un buen sonido sumado a peque√±as cinem√°ticas hacen que no se torne aburrido, claro est√° que este tipo de juegos es para jugarlos 1 vez cada muchos meses, ya que al todos tener una mec√°nica identidad, aunque las historias sean diferentes lo mismo se tornan repetitivos y aburridos pero sin dudas sirve para cambiar el clima y jugar algo distinto a los juegos modernos.
Como factores negativos podr√≠a marcar, primero algunos peque√±os errores de traducci√≥n al idioma espa√±ol (errores de ortograf√≠a, nombres incorrectos, etc) pero como digo son peque√±os y no dificultan el entendimiento de la trama ni de los pasos a seguir.
Segundo, si bien la mecaninca y  jugabilidad son muy buenas como por ejemplo el hecho de poder activar pistas si te quedas atascado o no puedes resolver un puzzle, no posee ninguna ayuda para completar logros una vez terminado (no se divide por niveles, o te deja recorrer escenarios ya visitados) si quieres platinar el juego tendr√°s que empezar y terminar la historia 1 y otra vez (completo) hasta que lo logres, pero al margen de eso, es muy recomendable.

Well the scenes still good, the mini games are indeed more challenging, even a little bit difficult sometimes~
Good to have different helper! And the Forest Spirits are really cute.
Sadly it's not as good as the former series, the storyline is too predictable, the characters are not attractive at all(talking about their motivation and personality, which is really a pity since this part was done great in the former one.)
Honestly I'm a little bit disappointed, because the reason I played this game is that I really enjoy the former one. I hope Grim Legends 3 will be more fascinating.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011284907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1452043542}
review:
Segunda parte de Grim Legends y segunda sorpresa que me llevo con esta compa√±√≠a, Artifex Mundi, especializada en este tipo de juegos (HOG o hidden object games). A pesar de ser segunda parte es una historia completamente diferente de la del 1, por lo que se puede jugar independientemente del primero pero contandos eso si, otro cuento donde la magia, los reinos y las brujas son los protagonistas. Dificultad media (recordad jugar en modo experto para que suponga pensar algo mas) arte igual de bonito que en el primero, aunque se nota menos trabajo en las secuencias animadas que ya casi no gozan de los efectos 3D del primero los cuales lo hac√≠an muy inmersivo. Por lo demas un gran juego, con buena duraci√≥n y cosas por coleccionar, ademas de un capitulo extra realmente divertido que se desbloquea tras completar el juego.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198059113985', 'num_games_owned': 312, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 971, 'last_played': 1451459113}
review:
A ideia de Grim legends √© bem simples, vc vai passar o jogo procurando objetos ocultos no cenarios, ideia simples porem divertida e ate desafiadora, jogo em portugues br oque ajuda muito saber qual item vc esta procurando e ate mesmo intender a historia do jogo que √© bem legal, o jogo vai le proporcionar boas horas de divers√£o e ate mesmo uma campanha bonus depois que vc fecha a campanha principal.

o grafico √© bem bunito embora seja imagem estatica, foi o primeiro jogo que minha esposa platino, e pra quem acha que platina vai ser facil se prepare pra mais de 15 hrs de gameplay.

enfim o jogo √© bem divertido e ele √© bem barato

OU SEJA BOM E BARATO otima conjunto de palavras, vc vai se divertir e se for comprar pra namorada ou esposa vai valer mais a pena ainda

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198169201551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 677, 'last_played': 1452122109}
review:
Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan has the same qualities as Grim Legends: The Forsaken Bride - the graphics are just AMAZING, the puzzles are marvelous, the scenes of hidden objects are perfect and the soundtrack creates an immersive atmosphere. Grim Legends series are my favorite point-and-click games ever!

Yet, the plot of the Song of the Dark Swan is weaker than The Forsaken Bride. You can guess who is the dark sorcerer without too much effort, at least I could. But this dosen¬¥t stop this game for being so amazing!

author: {'steamid': '76561198026806776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 302, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1449205198}
review:
[i]Song of the Dark Swan[/i] is a particularly well-done HOG.  It offers a nice mix of different types of HO scenes, hunting for plot coupons, and minigames of easy-to-middling difficulty.  It riffs broadly on the elements of [i]The Six Swans[/i] from the Brothers Grimm, but changes things up enough to keep the tale fresh.  

This would be an excellent introduction to the HO genre for beginners.  For those already familiar with the tropes of HO games, I recommend playing on Expert, as this, like all Artifex Mundi games I've encountered, leans towards the easy end of the spectrum.

review:
Me ha gustado mucho, al principio mucho m√°s que el primero porque la historia est√° bastante m√°s trabajada y los modelados de los personajes son bastante menos horrendos. 
Despu√©s de terminarlo, lo dicho anteriormente es lo √∫nico, los puzzles son casi exactamente los mismos, salvo alguna excepci√≥n, por otra parte nada que no se haya visto antes en este tipo de juegos. 
Las EOO son tambi√©n m√°s simplonas y en general el juego es m√°s corto que el anterior. 
Aqu√≠, de nuevo, hay bastantes defectos en la traducci√≥n, y no s√© si es porqu√© yo estaba con m√°s cansancio o porque jugu√© los dos juegos seguidos, pero en √©ste lo he acusado m√°s.

Por √∫ltimo, quisiera comentar el cap√≠tulo extra ... pero no s√© qu√© decir ... no tiene nada que ver con la historia ... no s√© qu√© palabra utilizar, ¬øoriginal? ¬øinesperado? ¬øbizarro? ¬øpotito?

Solid HOG game, very nice and detailed visuals, quite decent puzzles and fun gameplay. Story is also not bad

I don't have to high expectations when it comes to HOG games I like playing this type of games when my computer is rendering something or I waiting for client feedback and hog games and simple indie games are perfect for that, almost no resources are needed to play it and meantime I can do some heavy rendering and keep eye on progress on second screen while playing game :)
So almost any HOG game is perfect for me, it have to very bad to disappoint me and this one is very good :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198045208825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1475308258}
review:
[h1]Summary[/h1]
Decent HOG and puzzle game with a middling story and good mechanics. Good for a few hours of fun if you enjoy the genre. 

[h1]Review[/h1]
You play as the Healer, summoned to the Eagle Kingdom by the Eagle King to cure his nameless mute wife, the mother of his nameless son. Nameless sinister forces are at work however and make your task a great deal harder as the son is kidnapped, the wife accused of magic use (illegal by the decree of the otherwise nameless Peacock Queen, the Eagle King‚Äôs mother). Overall I found the story pretty bland and not as enjoyable as Grim Legends: The Forsaken Bride. There is very few twists and for the most part it is just good vs evil. The voice acting is mostly poor and the ‚Äúcharacters‚Äù are incredibly one-dimensional ‚Äì in case you had missed it, not a single person in the game even has a name. Hell, the wife‚Äôs nickname from one of her forest friends is ‚Äúlittle P‚Äù for little princess. Lazy.

Still, the game looks good and mechanically it is fine. Nothing really inventive or super challenging, but decent variety of HOGS and puzzles. So I would say it is good for a few hours of relaxing HOGing (I finished both the main story and the extra chapter in about 6.6 hours on Expert difficulty and with all achievements), but if you are looking for a challenge, inventive puzzles or a compelling story‚Ä¶ look elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064445036', 'num_games_owned': 1447, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1446143362}
review:
Was ist Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan? Ein Wimmelbild Spiel was etwas schafft was wenige gro√üe Spiele schaffe, seinen Vorg√§nger zu √ºberbieten. Ganz klar ist in diesem zusammenhang die Story zu nennen, welche etwas tiefer ist als im Vorg√§nger. Desweiteren wurde das Gameplay Element aus Teil 1 ( indem man einen Katze l√§ngere Zeit im Inventar hat und mit dieser R√§tsel l√∂sen soll ) erweitert, da es hier mehrere solche Situationen im Spiel gibt. Die Spielewelt ist wie immer Wundersch√∂n, die R√§tsel sind gut, kommen einen aber aus anderen Wimmelbildspielen leider bekannt vor. Naturlich gibt es wieder ein Bonuskapitel, Sammelitems und viele viele Screens mit Objekten und R√§tsel. Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan ist eine super Fortsetzung welche in fast allen Punken besser ist als sein Vorg√§nger, leider waren manche R√§tsel schon bekannt. Trotzdem f√ºr Wimmelbildfreunde ein muss und somit Daumen hoch.

F√ºr eine Echte Legende hier klicken:http://www.twitch.tv/thebenjaminkendrick

author: {'steamid': '76561198009194021', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1446617463}
review:
[b]Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan[/b] is a casual point and click adventure game set in a fantasy/fairy tale world. For adventure gamers who aren't particularly fond of hidden object scenes, I have pleasant news, as hidden object scenes in Grim Legends 2 occur very occasionally. The bulk of the gameplay consists of exploration, inventory-based puzzles, and a large variety of puzzle mini-games, and I found myself being constantly impressed by how refreshing the mini-game selection was. I play a LOT of point and click adventure games (or HOPAs) and consider myself to be very picky within this genre, however, I never felt like I had a dull moment exploring the beautiful and immersive world of Grim Legends 2. The storyline is a bit cheesy, but that's OK, as some characters were memorable and lovable, and the artwork and music was of a very high-quality. I think what stood out most to me in this game was how beautiful the scenery was.

Keep in mind that this is a Collector's Edition (this fact isn't mentioned on the Steam store page). This means that aside from the main game/story, there's also a (much smaller) bonus game/story, as well as goodies to include wallpapers, concept art and re-playable hidden object mini-games. The main game as well as the bonus game took me about 4 hours to complete on Expert mode, so you can expect a similar amount of gameplay hours if you're familiar with point and click games.

[b]TLDR: Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan is a well-made point and click adventure game, with a variety of enjoyable puzzles, lovely artwork and music, adequate voice acting, and a storyline that isn't too remarkable.[/b] I would recommend it (on sale) to anyone who enjoys point and click adventure games, particularly those who enjoy fantasy settings. It's an excellent game for young children who have demonstrated interest in fairy tales, too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198196285207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1447603421}

author: {'steamid': '76561198038583325', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1058, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1627760310}
review: Within less than two weeks I've gotten seven games by Artifex & OMG I'm loving them all!!! (Enigmatis 1&2 are my faves so far ;) ). Song of the Dark Swan is the latest I've beaten and it seemed shorter than The Forsaken Bride, but I still adored it! Plot is familiar (but not exactly what you expect), the artwork is gorgeous and the puzzles challenging. Keep up the OUTSTANDING work, Artifex!!! Go Grim Legends 3!!!!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025089300', 'num_games_owned': 1090, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1445824969}
review:
[u]Pros:[/u]
- Descent music, sounds and voices
- Graphics are fine
- Some puzzles are a bit more original than usual
- I always enjoy the theatre-like puzzles
- Uses the modern interface/system of the more recent games from this company

[u]Cons:[/u]
- Animations are sometimes weird, as in all their other games, since they are based more on blending and morphing pictures than different frames. However, it's quite well done for this type of animation.
- Several hidden objects scenes have objects with arbitrary shapes that look like nothing you're familiar with and that makes them artificially hard to find.
- Not enough hidden objects scenes for this type of game.
- The maze section relies on clues that are not clear: I finished the game 3 times and I'm still not sure I understood the logic.
- A few puzzles are illogical (more than the average for this kind of game). [spoiler]For instance, using the saliva of the "snail" to glue the eagle figurine. Firstly, using saliva to glue stone makes no sense. Secondly, you have to put the piece on the saliva directly, while the game got you used to collect liquids in recipients before using them.[/spoiler]
- There's also one instance where you have to backtrack way too much just to get one object that was hard to notice in the first place. [spoiler]You have to get out of the Dark Castle to get the arrow for the crossbow.[/spoiler]
- Lastly, and that's disapointing for this type of game, I didn't like the story: it made no sense to me, probably because it was badly told.

[u]Conclusion:[/u]
While it's not a terrible game, it is one of the worst HO games from Artifex Mundi.
I didn't enjoy it as much as their other titles. I'd recommend playing those instead, unless you've finished them all already.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968357064', 'num_games_owned': 11834, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1444139753}
review:
Druhy dil pohadkove serie hidden object adventur od Artifexu. Opet autori vyuzili motivu z pohadek bratri Grimmu. Tentokrat se ocividne inspirovali bud pohadkou "Sedmero krkavcu" nebo "Sestero labuti". Hra ma sice opet zenskou hrdinku, bylinkarku, ale prisla mi trochu mene cilena na zeny-hracky nez "svatebni" prvni dil, protoze pribeh je neutralnejsi. Hrac ma za ukol vysetrit a vylecit nemou kralovnu Labutiho kralovstvi, coz se hned zahy zvrtne.
Co se tyce postupu v pribehu, pouzivani predmetu ci hadanek, z vetsi casti je hrani bezproblemove. Je tu ovsem par puzzlu, ktere dokazou vytocit. Vetsinou jde o nejake posouvani ci zapinani/vypinani cehosi, coz ale zaroven ovlivnuje sousedni jednotky. To dela techto par miniher dost tezkymi. Na jednu stranu je to plus, protoze uplne lehkou adventuru nemusim, ale na druhou je u nich tezke prijit na logiku ci spravny postup a jsou spis otravnou zalezitosti typu pokus-omyl. Takze je muzete nahodou vyresit za minutu, ale taky na ne klikat ctvrt hodiny bez vysledku :) 
V pribehu se k vam obcas pripoji nejaky ten pomocnik, podobne jako kote v jednicce, ale tady jich je nekolik - vlastovka, vydra, lesni duch.
Grafika je opet kvalitne nakreslena, jako z pohadkovych knizek (takova "stetcova" poctiva malba), ale trochu mi ve screenech chybel pocit hloubky. Vetsina hernich obrazovek totiz pusobi jaksi "plose". Zvuk ci hudba me nijak neohromily, ale tak aspon nejsou otravne.
Nejvetsim plusem teto serie je, ze se jedna o samostatne kousky, nijak na sebe nenavazujici. Spolecne maji jen pohadkove motivy. "Dark Swan" ma navic proti jednicce plus v tom, ze nemusite hru kvuli 100% achievementum dohravat dvakrat (huraaa, zadne domino hry). Ale zase ma par vyse zminenych nedostatku, takze hodnotim stejne.
V CE edici mate opet wallpapery, OST, artworky a bonusovou kapitolu, ktera se sklada ze dvou kratickych pribehu, tykajicich se lesnich duchu. Pokud chcete hru cesky, stahujte z [url=http://www.alawarhry.cz/game/grim-legends-song-of-the-dark-swan-collectors-edition/]Alawaru[/url].
[na zaver dulezita rada pro nalezeni 100% lecivych znaku - u vetsiny obrazovek sviti u spodniho okraje lahvicka, pokud je znak na screenu pritomen; ovsem na stene veze, za kterou najdete kralovnu, tento indikator nic nedela - zrejme bug - a tudiz byste znak ani nehledali; takze pozor na to, je zeleny, mezi brectanem]

[h1]70%[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198035054806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 201, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1442445182}
review:
Was given a key for review



Once again Artifex Mundi has handed us a really good hidden object game. They make these well folks, always. 

This time you get to play in a 1700ty/1800ty ish fantasy playground. Fight Dark sorcery with herbal spells and your ability to find those lost bits. 

Do you know the Dark Swan myth? Then you understand the plot. Ever want to play a part within a old myth? Here you get to. That's the joy of this series. There are a few twists and those are the fun surprises.

This isn't part 2 of the story of Grim Legends 1, it's a second grim legend. If they ever make a third one I can easily imagine it will be yet a another different legend.

Pros
Nice music. 
Well use of voice acting.
It's pretty. Just plain outright pretty to look at and watch.
Middle level gameplay. Spend a few mins and you'll rarely have to use the hint button.

Cons (of a sort)
Lack of gameplay inovation. It's just like nearly every other well made hidden object game. This isn't a bad thing but it's almost as if they used a formula.
Not really a mystery, if you rember the myth. 


This is a really well made hidden object game. Definatly worth buying and adding to your collection.


Interested in more reviews like this : http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Original_Curators_Group#curation

author: {'steamid': '76561197981706607', 'num_games_owned': 4148, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1443054415}
review: This is another of the Artifex Mundi HOGs, with high production values, lots of puzzles, and not so many Hidden Object Scenes.  The story has nothing to do with the first game in the series, and is a loose variation on the seven swans. Some of the puzzles and actions needed are extremely obtuse, but most everything flows pretty well together.  The story is pretty incidental compared to some of the other games, but it works well enough.  The entire game (including the bonus adventure) took around three hours to complete, which is a little short for these kinds of games, but long enough for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978705200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1441512415}
review:
Another day, another Hidden Object Game. This time around it's Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan. I'm going to go ahead and say that this is easily the best HOG I've played yet. Admittedly, it doesn't sound like much since this is also only the fourth one I've played, but all the same. With its combination of spectacular art, great music, a solid story, and quality puzzles, I can't think of a reason for genre fans to avoid this title.

The plot starts off simple enough. You're a herbalist of some fame, and a king rolls out the red carpet, in the hopes that you can cure his queen's ailment. The queen can't speak and...eh well the rest is on you to figure out. There's a mystery to solve, a handful of twists and turns, and you're going to figure it all out and save the day. However, if you fail then...that would be silly! This is a HOG after all, the answer is always one click away. How you proceed is up to you. Skip through all of the puzzles to focus on the story? Or take your time and get your money's worth? 

For those unfamiliar with the genre, a good Hidden Object Game is more than just finding trinkets. HOGs should also offer numerous puzzles, a compelling plot, and quality presentation. Like most adventure games, a HOG doesn't have much in the way of replay-value, so it's massively important that the few hours of game-play it offers are memorable. Grim Legends 2 is very successful in this regard. The art-direction employs some great usage of colors, and despite lacking 4k or even 2k resolution, can still astonish with its well-drawn environments. For the most part, the hidden object portions of this game are designed intelligently. The pieces are creatively hidden, and are sometimes unique, such as pieces of an elaborate necklace, or the parts of a magnifying glass. The difficulty is also well-balanced, so you'll feel that at least some effort is necessary. This makes progressing through the adventure more fulfilling.

As far as nitpicks go (don't act so surprised!) the NPCs can look rather strange. It's hard to describe. They have this uncanny valley when they speak to you. Perhaps that isn't the right term for it, but it certainly looks unnatural. Aside from being a blemish on the otherwise fantastic art-direction, weirdo NPC faces isn't a big deal. The herbalist's voice-acting is a little suspect at times, but again...nothing major. Everyone else in the game picks up the slack quite nicely.

All in all this is a great title to look into whether you're already fans of the genre, or a newcomer looking for a worthwhile entry point.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198188927953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1462842984}
review:
This game is enjoyable and can be done in a few hours, you play a healer and have come to cure the queen and prove her innocent, and quite amazing how it is story driven the women on front of game is the queen not your character in game. It feels like a thriller movie where you are wondering what is going to happen or how many deaths will occur. You do get some help from a bird, magical creature and also a beaver which is good 
as they will alert you when they will help you. I got this on special,so buy it whhen it is cheap as it is only a few hours long, 

I have started the bonus chapter where you play as the magical creature and on duty of the village.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983225082', 'num_games_owned': 864, 'num_reviews': 321, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1446156627}
review:
I was not a big fan of the first Grim Legends. I was confused most of the game. This game seems to be a lot more focused and I also like the graphics a lot. They look like a painting. They are really very good looking. The sound is also another plus. 

The puzzles again are sort of hit and for me mostly a miss. Most just are not a lot of fun. The Guardian footprint puzzle is a good case of what are they thinking? Match the footprint with the animal. Does anyone know what a dragoon foortprint would look like? I didnt. Skip.

The story is interesting and like I said before the gameplay is more focused. I do understand where to go and why I am going there. You get to have different helpers in this game including a bird and an otter and others. This is a great idea. I like it a lot more then say just having one animal.  So  great graphics, great sound and an interesting and cool story.  This is a good hidden object game. A lot better in my opinion then Grim Legends 1.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043862034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1441076192}
review: High-quality art style and animations as well as Hidden Object scenes that aren't too difficult. A few of the puzzles gave me some grief, but otherwise they're fun with a bit of a challenge. This game was definitely not as long as the first installment, but still a good length, at least a few hours of entertainment with an alright plot. I like my HOG plot's to be a bit creepier/darker, but not necessarily scary, but aside from pushing the envelope  further plot-wise for a series called, "Grim Legends" it's an entertaining game, especially for the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007453123', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1440795097}
review:
Ich finde dass der zweite Teil ist eine gelungene Fortsetzung zu der Reihe Grim Legends ist. 
Dieser Teil hat √§hnliche R√§tzel wie der erste und noch weitere neue mit eingebracht.
Der Zeichenstiel und die Animationen sind anders gestaltet als im ersten, aber nicht weniger liebevoll und mit vielen sch√∂nen Details, die besonders bei den Wimmelbildern zu sehen sind.
Das Ende war mir pers√∂nlich etwas zu √ºberst√ºrzt aber die Geschichte selber ist sch√∂n umgesetzt.
Toll fand ich, dass es wieder ein Begleittier gibt, diesmal sogar verschiedene.

Es k√∂nnen gerne noch weitere Teile zu der Grim Legends Reihe hinzukommen :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198120993683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1440211316}
review: My favorite game from this company. I love the fairy tale that this game is based on and it's one that gets so little attention. The story is well written (unlike some other of this company's games) and the backgrounds and graphics are beautiful. And the HO and puzzles are complex and not super easy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067483146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1440964206}
review: Grim Legend 2 es un juego fantastico, con unos elaborados graficos en 2d muy cuidados. La unica pega que le pongo en cuanto a su apartado artistico es la baja resolucion de algunas imagenes, aunque no enturvian para nada ni la experiencia jugable ni le quitan ese aire de cuento cautivador.  Pero si en proximas entregas arreglaran ese problema, el juego quedaria mucho mas bonito. A pesar de ser considerado como "casual", lo recomiendo si te apetece jugar a algo sencillo para matar el aburrimiento. La trama es sencilla y facil de seguir, no se hace pesada en ningun momento y dura lo justo. Cierto es que el juego no es muy largo, se puede pasar del tiron; pero no aburre, y cuenta con un capitulo extra. En definitiva, si te gustan los juegos casual de objetos ocultos y demas creo que este producto es una buena opcion ; )

review: Very good HOG by Artifex Mundi that revisits Brothers Grimm's fairytale about the princess and her cursed brothers, transformed into swans. Graphics are good, nice Hidden Object scenes and puzzles and as usual there's an extra chapter with some backstory. The expert difficulty isn't very challenging if you already played games like this but I still think that this is one of the best HOGs on Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080001787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1439659744}
review:
I've been trying games of this sort for a few days now and I have to say that 'Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan' is my favorite so far. One of the games I have tried is GL: The Forsaken Bride but I really liked this one better, everything from the soundtrack (which is amazing), storyline, characters was very well thought out.

In GL2: Song of the Dark Swan, you are a healer summoned by the king to check on the health condition of his queen. Without giving it away, let's just say that you end up getting more than what you signed up for ehehe. The story is interesting, much more than the Forsaken Bride, more so, that at some point you even feel sorry for what is happening to some of the characters and that is something that I didn't feel while playing FBride.

The minigames/puzzles are quite similar to the one's on FBride so you won't feel much difficulty there if you managed to do them on the previous game. However, If my memory serves me, I think there are a few that are a bit different but still doable.

As I mentioned before the soundtrack is beautiful, it gives a special touch to the story and makes it even more amazing and captivating. The artwork is fantastic, the characters are wonderfuly presented with nice details. 

Oh and lets not forget the little helpers! On the Dark Swan they are super cute and, of course, you'll get more than one. For those of you who don't know, on Grim Legends games you usually have little guys that help you advance in the story (don't worry they don't work as hints or cheats, etc).

The only thing that I liked a bit more on the Forsaken Bride than on Dark Swan was the Bonus Content. I felt that on FB it worked better as a continuance of the main story and I didn't felt that with the DS bonus content.

If you like games like this then I suggest buying it, being it in a bundle, on sales or at regular price, it's well worth the purchase :)

review:
"Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan" is a tough one to rate.  On one hand, Artifex Mundi (AM) has improved their Achievements so they aren't mutually exclusive.  In other words, we're not forced to make two run throughs to get all Achievements (yay!).  Also, the graphics seem to be a bit sharper and brighter than earlier games.  On the other hand, the voice acting is much worse than normal.  Some of the voice acting is on par with other AM games (i.e., tolerable).  But, the queen's voice acting is bad and the various children's voice acting is utterly horrible.  I cringed every time I had to click on those kids and listen to their "acting."  Ugh.  To go along with the bad voice acting, the story is even worse than usual for these casual adventure Hidden Object games (HOGs).  So, instead of an OK-cutesy story, this one tends towards the OK-silly side.  If it weren't for the dead bodies lying around, I'd even lean towards it being written for kids (especially in the Bonus Chapter).  I'd also like to mention that even though this game is classified as a HOG, most of the puzzles are NOT technically HOGs:  they're FROGs (Fragmented/Fractured Object Game).  Plus, most of the HOGs are of the type where you have to find a bunch of fairies or a bunch of flowers and not of the type where you have a hodgepodge of various items hidden among other miscellany.  Of course, that could be good or bad, depending on your tastes.

Unfortunately, I didn't properly record my actual game play time.  So, I can't give the exact duration of the game.  But, it took me about 8 hours to finish the whole thing with 100% Achievements:  a little over 6 hours for the main game and 1.7 hours for the Bonus Chapter.  So, with the pluses and minuses noted above, coupled with the slightly short game play, I'm recommending the game.  But, only if you can find it on sale.  I'd say you should buy it if you can find it for less than six dollars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016427463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1438813482}
review: I love hidden object games, and the first in this series was the first HOG I've played in a while. It was fantastic, but I think this one topped it overall. I loved the art, the story, the music, the gameplay--pretty much everything. The only thing that bothered me was that [spoiler]the sorceress was pregnant with the king's child. But who was that? Was he the sibling with the dark hair (swans) or was he the king from the eagle kingdom? I didn't get that at all.[/spoiler] Other than that, it was an awesome game! I'm looking forward to playing more games from this company.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011275720', 'num_games_owned': 562, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1438812854}
review:
I'm not generally impressed by casual games or hidden object games, but this was really well done -- enough that I'm now on the lookout for other well-reviewed games from this company that go on sale.

It's an adventure game, in which you go from screen to screen looking for objects to help you on your quest, and along the way are basic puzzles to solve.  There is occassionally a hidden object puzzle, but not nearly as many as I was expecting.  It was a good pace, the art was great, and there wasn't any point at which I was really stumped.  More to the point, I was able to find all of the objects within a couple of rooms, and never felt like I was wandering all over the place trying to pixel hunt.

The story was interesting to follow, though obvious to where it was going.  Most of the voice acting was pretty good -- at least compared to other casual games I've played.  There was only one or two characters (younger boys) that I was taken out of the game by.

One minor note.. if you have a tablet, the games seem to be quite a bit cheaper there ($5 versus $10), but the steam sales can get down a bit further if you watch for them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007479208', 'num_games_owned': 1768, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1505442407}
review:
While Grim Legends 2 isn't particularly inventive with most of its puzzle design, the presentation is fabulous and makes the game a joy to play. The puzzles are still fun, even if they stick a little too closely to the formula employed by the first game in the series, and by seek-and-find games in general. Most of the puzzles probably won't give most people pause, but they are varied and enjoyable for casual play.  

The graphics are, by far, this game's greatest strength. They're sumptuously drawn, just like in the first Grim Legends. Progressing through the game is rewarded with eye candy in the form of beautiful scenery. You'll meet friendly, helpful creatures along the way, and one of the creatures even plays an unexpected part in the bonus chapter, which I thought was refreshing. I took my time, admired the art, and enjoyed this game's classic fairy tale atmosphere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013914895', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1687404871}
review:
Fun game, engaging story. It's too bad it fell apart with the ending. The ending was very aprut and rushed feeling with no real closer. The bonus game would have done better wrapping up the loose threads from the main game. Also disappointed in the fate of the titular Dark Swan but ah well. Still wondering WHY dark and handom is seen playing a volin in the promational stuff, as there is no real 'music' theme and the character never plays any song.  Overall the first game was stronger. 

I'll recommend this game: if it is on sale. Don't pay the full 10 for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007688772', 'num_games_owned': 1260, 'num_reviews': 648, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1437662845}
review: Another decent hidden object game from Artifex Mundi. However, there's nothing special about this game I haven't seen many times before. Not a single minigame was original. Also the game actions get too repetitive, too often it's just "insert a magical object into a magical slot", over and over again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102966368', 'num_games_owned': 1367, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1437165735}
review:
Artifex Mundi is a name that I associate with good quality games. I enjoyed the previous "Grim Legends", so I was really looking forward to this one.

[h1]Like[/h1]

[b]Graphics[/b]
The game has wonderful artwork. Very detailed and colorful. 

[b]Puzzles[/b]

There's a good variety of them and they are all fairly easy to solve. A tip for someone else: When you need to guide the princess wood piece across the map... don't drag the piece. Just click where you want her to go. I wish I knew that before raging because the piece kept jumping around and breaking the puzzle.

The hidden object scenes dosen't overload every scene with thousand of objects. All objects are clear and in a realistic size for the environment they are in. Everything is easy to find once you know what you are looking for. There were perhaps 2-3 objects which were a bit colorless that took a harder time to find.

[b]Story[/b]
It was unusually grim for a Artifex Mundi game. But I like that, it added suspence to the story and even if you didn't get to know the characters too well, you still felt very sorry for them. It deals with a lot of emotions of even the background characters, such as guilt, regret, pain and grief. 

[h1]Dislike[/h1]

[b]Voice-acting[/b]

It isn't awful (except for the children), but it is the same woman as every other game. Can't they hire someone else? She is okay, but obviously still can't bother to do any form of shouting or screaming in terror. 2 out of 3 times she doesn't even bother, even though it clearly says "Ah!" in the subtitles. 

[b]Main character[/b]

The person you control is only known as "healer" and all she does is make healing brews out of herbs and solve the mystery. I just didn't like her for some reason. Usually I don't care that much about the anonymous main character, but this one was so dense. You figure things out long before she even puts anything together. I guess for the sake of the story she has to be dumb so the player can figure things out on their own, but most things are too obvious not to figure out on your own. She even finds a book that has the solution painted and she still doesn't get it! I can overlook this though for the sake of "story needing to unfold" and if the main character spoils it to early, it might ruin the pace of the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042831386', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 627, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1433608888}
review:
[h1]Short version: 80%[/h1]
Grim Legends 2 is a beautiful fragmented object game set in a fairy tale land. It‚Äôs not as memorable as its predecessor, but it can be a great addition to the library of any Artifex Mundi fan.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan is a sequel in name only. The fairy tale setting remained, but everything else changed‚Äì including the sub-genre, which is now fragmented object.

The story is a spin on the Grimm fairy tale ‚ÄòThe Twelve Brothers‚Äô: a heartbroken evil sorceress curses a kingdom, turns the seven sons of the royal family into swans, and their sister mute. You start the game several years later, after said sister married and had a child, whom is promptly kidnapped. Your task is, naturally, to save the infant and break the curse while you‚Äôre at it.

The fragmented object (and the few hidden object) scenes all have the usual high Artifex Mundi quality, whereas the conventional puzzles are a bit repetitive. The story uses a rather strange route with a lot of backtracking. This can make life pretty overcomplicated on the highest difficulty, but it can also give the game an unusually long play time for its worth.

review: After the delight the first game was in this series, I came into this one with high expectations - and they were met! Equally gorgeous artwork, engaging storyline, and difficult but not too hard puzzles. The voice acting was solid, and the plot unpredictable. Definitely worth every penny for any sort of fairytale or Hidden Object Game fan!

author: {'steamid': '76561198094200639', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1630866822}
review: Having just begun the game, one is totally engrossed. You find yourself almost compelled to go on to see how, when, why, where. One must know all the secrets and free everyone. Justice must prevail. Lol, not nearly so seriously, but the urge is there and there is the feeling that you want to right the wrongs if that is your nature. There are different layers within the game. not your usual object search , but also puzzles within puzzles and more. It's fun actually.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067294550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1436039040}
review: As with the previous game I found it fun! A great version of a beloved fairytale! Some of the puzzles take me a little while but I really like the challenges. I will keep playing as long as Artifex Mundi keeps making them. Looking forward to the next Grim Legends.

review:
Dear Artifex Mundi, your game is beautiful, but PLEASE, when you localize the game in Italian, do NOT translate the title "Grim Legends" into "Leggende Deprimenti", because that actually means "Depressing Legends", and it's just plain awful.
A better translation could be "Tetre Leggende", for example.
Sincerely,
a customer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027424772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1520540494}
review:
[b][u]Game Information[/u][/b]

"Grim Legends: Song of the Dark Swan" Collector's Edition is a Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure game. The game was developed and published by Artifex Mundi.

"Song of the Dark Swan" is the second episode of "Grim Legends." Previous episode: "The Forsaken Bride."

Since this is a collector's edition game, it comes with extra features that are not available in its' counterpart; the standard edition.

[b][u]The Game Review[/u][/b]

Game Visuals

I want to mention that the visuals in the game are nicely done with a painted feel to them. The visuals can be adjusted in the game's option menu.

Game Audio

I want to mention that audio for the game is well done. Even though the audio is somewhat simplistic and repetitive. The audio can be adjusted in the game's option menu as well.

Gameplay

There are three different difficulty game modes to choose from: Casual; Advanced and Expert.

The notebook keeps track of progression in the game. Such as story events and clues.

There is an interactive map in the game. It allows the player to fast travel between each location quickly without having the need to constantly backtrack. It also indicates that there are a variety of tasks that can be completed at various locations within the game. The interactive map is automatically given at the start of the game.

There is a padlock feature that is available to lock the inventory panel in place to make it stationary.

The hidden object scenes consist of the following: Find "x" amount; Shadow items; Fragmented items and Traditional word lists. Some of these hidden object scenes may require little or no interactions. Most of the hidden object scenes can be replayed in the game's extra feature section.

The puzzles are fairly easy to solve without having the need to skip any of them.

There is a collectible in the game: Healer's Sigil. They are scattered throughout the game for the player to find.

Since this is a collector's edition game, there is a bonus chapter, but it can be accessed only after the main story is completed.

There are twenty-nine different achievements that can be unlocked from playing the game. Each of these achievements does come with some requirements that need to be completed before they can be unlocked.

Miscellaneous

There are extra features in the game: Bonus Chapter; Bonus Hidden Object Scenes; Bonus Puzzles; Soundtracks; Concept Art and Wallpapers. Most of these extra features can be accessed only after the entire game is completed.

There are six different trading cards to collect. Only three of those trading cards are given out by the game. There are several ways to get the rest of the trading cards: Purchased from the Steam's Community Market; Trade with friends; Booster Packs and its Booster Pack Creator.

Final thoughts: I have found the game enjoyable to a certain extent. The replay value for the game is low. I would recommend this game, but not at the game's full price value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034116984', 'num_games_owned': 2007, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1466934097}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024920171', 'num_games_owned': 880, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1433563655}
review:
While not exactly a direct follow-up to the first Grim Legends games, Song of the Dark Swan hits all the same high marks. It's got a beautiful setting, and a fun story. The puzzles and hidden object games are well done. And it's got both polish and heart. I love the company that makes these games, and they seem to keep getting better at what they do.

As with the other Artifex Mundi games, I'd highly recommend this one to anyone interested in puzzles, hidden object games, and original stories. Plus, no need to play the first game to enjoy this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090366497', 'num_games_owned': 710, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1433462027}
review:
Whilst not as good as Grim Legends, it's still a solid entry in this genre. Again, you play a female protagonist (this time the unnamed healer) as you amble through a retelling of a fairy tale, although given the choice of fairy tale this renders certain elements of the tale quite nonsensical. 

Compared to the others by this developer I found this one relied a little too often on obscuring items with immovable objects which made them awkward to spot, but none of the puzzles, hidden object or otherwise, are too hard. The bonus chapter is set before the story but has no real relationship to it. I've gotta say I barely noticed the soundscapes, and where Grim Legends had a cute kitten, it felt like they'd tried to improve on that by offering you a variety of helpers throughout the game, but with such a short game and such infrequent use of the various companions it was hard to be too attached. Still they were all cute and the game is just fine. I suspect the it was the mangling of one of my favourite childhood tales that irked me slightly with this one.

Oh and the pronunciation of "ginormous."

author: {'steamid': '76561198009026799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1433442656}
review:
I have fallen in love with Artifex Mundi games. I have only played a handful, but they are very simple yet very fun point and click adventures. To top it off, all of the ones I have played so far have very interesting and engaging stories, and GL2 is probably the high point for me so far. 

My only slight gripe is the occasional typo or other grammar mistakes, but as the AM team is based in Poland, I do not begrudge them that.

review:
[H1] VERSION COURTE [/H1]

[i]Grim Legend II[/i] est un [i]d'objets cach√©s[/i] assez basique dans on genre, et pourtant il a tant √† offrir. Vous incarnez une personne dot√©e de pouvoirs de gu√©rison. Vous √™tes appel√© aupr√®s de la reine du pays pour la soigner. Cependant, un mal profond gronde dans les terres, et l'enfant de la reine finit par √™tre kidnapp√©e. C'est √† ce moment m√©lodramatique que commence votre aventure ... et je dois bien avouer que √ßa a de la gueule. Les graphismes sont plut√¥t chouette, la bande son tr√®s dynamique tout en √©tant relaxante, et l'histoire est tr√®s int√©ressante. Malheureusement le jeu m'a quelque peu ... d√©√ßu. Le jeu suit une courbe de difficult√© ascendante et le d√©but vous offre une suite logique d'objets et d'actions, et m√™me sans vraiment savoir ce qu'il y a faire, vous le devinez, tout de m√™me, assez facilement. Malheureusement, apr√®s avoir fait trois quarts du jeu, j'ai eu l'impression que le jeu abandonnait toute la logique de progression ... logique que j'avais √©norm√©ment appr√©ci√©e, puisqu'elle permet de suivre l'histoire tranquillement. Mais la fin ... compl√®tement perdu. On ramasse des objets, et on ne sait pas quoi en faire, c'est aussi simple que √ßa. Toutefois, je recommande le jeu pour son histoire et son ambiance √† toutes personnes souhaitant suivre une histoire tranquillement, sans se prendre la t√™te.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046426199', 'num_games_owned': 3057, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1431798365}
review:
One of the best Artifex Mundi game ever! (2015.05.) Story is exciting, it has various mini games and there's only two (?!) find-by-name minigame in it. If you like casual point and click games, you must definitely get it!

Oh, and one more thing: there's no connection between Legends of Grim 1 and this game. Although the first part is a superb game as well, you can skip or leave it later, if you don't have it already.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015845179', 'num_games_owned': 913, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1431232957}
review:
Artifex Mundi delivers again!

While the plot is a bit obvious, mainly if you've read the fairytale before, it's still kept interesting. The artwork is amazing and it's reallly fun to have different animal helpers. The hidden object scenes are typically not your, "here's a list of items to find" but usually find multiple of one type of item in a scene or find all the items pictured below. There are a few typical object scenes but the mixture keeps it fresh and won't leave you randomly clicking by end game. The puzzles are inventive and while a lot are repeated from other games, they've been adjusted for this game's setting and feel new. The voice acting could be better but I think the Princess' was the best... (She's mute btw).

The story is a bit short, it took me a little over 2 hours to beat but the additional bonus story adds another good hour. If you want to travel to a different land and experience high quality point and click game play, this game is perfect.

9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197969267147', 'num_games_owned': 7582, 'num_reviews': 572, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1431162451}
review:
I'm giving this a thumbs up, but just barely.

This is a mediocre but decent casual point-and-click adventure. There are very few mini-game puzzles or hidden-object scenes: it's almost purely very easy point-and-click. The story is unrelated to Grim Legends 1, so please ignore that marketing nonsense.

If I'm really pushed to mention something special about this game (hard!) then I would say that the fareries are really cute. I guess that's something? Otherwise, it's run-of-the-mill fantasy nonsense, king and queen and dark magic and such.

The "bonus adventure," by the way, is a complete throwaway. The puzzles make zero sense. Just click on everything all the time and you should be OK. ;)

I would also like to thank the developer for supporting Linux.

review: I really enjoy this game and the other one of this series. The stories for the games are so in depth and very imaginative making it very difficult to quit playing. I love that with each series, there's a main story and also a spin off which makes the game even more interesting even after you've finished the main story line. It's a great game for those who either don't like the mainstream type games or need a break from them, because this game makes you think and use your brain in a different way. I overall have enjoyed this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071085861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1429979886}
review:
This is a short game for those of you that like Hidden-Object games and Mystery/Puzzle-Solvers. You can practically finish it in a day, unless you want to get more of those achievments in which case you can play it through a few more times. The artwork is beautiful and some of them you can have for wallpapers even, music also is nice if not slightly repetitive. The voice acting in the cut-scenes I found kinda bad which ruined the game slightly for me personally, but they do serve their purpose. The storyline is decently thought out, even though I guessed all of it quite early on. 
All in all its a simple, casual game that is enjoyable and relaxing to play, I'd recommend it only if you're really into this kind of game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063193728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1685323071}
review:
You do not have to play Grim Legends 1 to play this one, since they are two completely different tales.

Very good story. You catch on fairly early that this is the tale of the princess and her seven brothers turned to swans. If you do not know the tale, I'll let you find out by yourself.
You play a young healer that has been summoned to a castle by the King to take care of his sick and mute wife. The Queen is very beautiful and has given birth to a son, she is always accompanied by the Kings mother. Not long after you arrive a strange green fog engulfs the queens quarters and kidnaps the prince. The rest is for you to find out!! Have fun!
I recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072110088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1427915246}
review:
Song of the Dark Swan ist der zweite Teil der Grim Legends Wimmelbild-Reihe von Artifex Mundi. Wie Teil 1 "The forsaken Bride" ist es ein Spiel, das sehr an ein M√§rchen erinnert und auch so aufgebaut ist. Es beginnt zwar nicht mit "Es war einmal", aber der Verlauf der Geschichte ist gleich dem einem M√§rchen - Apropo Geschichte, diese ist gut, stimmig und ohne Logikfehler. √úberraschende Wendungen enth√§lt sie schon, auch wenn man direkt zu Beginn erahnen kann, wer der B√∂se ist. 
Grafik, Atmosph√§re und Soundtrack waren dabei wie immer klasse und langweilten nicht. Die Minispiele sind abwechslungsreich und die Wimmelbilder enthielten keine Fehlbezeichnungen von Obejkten. Alles in allem war ein guter Anspruch bei den R√§tseln gegeben.
Daher kann ich Grim Legends 2 Song of theDark Swan ohne Bedenken jedem Wimmelbild / Hidden-Object Fan an's Herz legen, es ist bisher einer der besten Teile von Artifex Mundi.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961553883', 'num_games_owned': 7374, 'num_reviews': 376, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1428331359}
review:
On its own, this is a good hidden object game. Puzzles are detailed and beautiful, the storyline is well worked out and, while lifting on a well-known fairytale, still has twists.
All screens are partially animated, making the world feel alive, and the cinematic scenes are the developer's best work yet.

Compared to its predecessor however, Grim Legends 2 disappoints a little. Voice acting is of a lesser quality, with even cases where the subtitles and voice dialogue don't match.
Gameplay wise, there is only one kind of optional collectable to the previous games' two kinds, and you can no longer opt out of a hidden object puzzle for another kind of game: you now only have the option to use the hint button instead.

Fortunately both have standalone stories, so you won't necessarily need to buy "2" for story reasons.

Good is that the companion idea from the previous game returns, with now not just one critter helping you, but a new one per chapter. They are also used more, and feel more relevant to the story.
There is also more variation in the puzzles this time than just combine A with B or slide puzzles, so there is less idea of repetition here. You also backtrack less than in Grim Legends 1.

Overall Grim Legends 2 is a polished game well worth playing, but I feel more could have been done with it to make it a proper sequel to the first game. Taking it as a standalone though, I can definitely recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960281919', 'num_games_owned': 1160, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1428231927}
review:
If you have played some of the other games from Artifex you will not be surprised to hear that this game follows the same basic principles, its a story that needs to be solved by doing puzzles and using your brain (the brainpart is kind of hard for me as im stupido)

The good stuff
- Graphics look really nice in this one, crisp and awesome
- Sounds are totally ok
- Story is engaging
- Minigames are challenging but fun
- Nice and slow pace compared to alot of modern games

The Bad stuff
- Minigames can be frustrating if you are somewhat braindead (like me)
- Some things you need to find can be quite hard to locate

Check the lets play here, roughly the first hour or so of gameplay

https://youtu.be/TtGR4A4TTLw

author: {'steamid': '76561198001113182', 'num_games_owned': 3205, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1428139509}
review:
Artifex Mundi has come a long way and their Hidden Object games keep getting better and better. Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan is definitely no exception.

While the second installment of the Grim Legends series it is not a sequel and this game can be played and enjoyed without knowledge of the former. Though I do recommend [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/284850]that one[/url] as well as it is very good.

This game is rich and colorful, comes with a handy fast travel map and all the usual things you'd expect in a Hidden Object game. While in Grim Legends 1 you'd only get help from a single pet [i](a very cute kitty!)[/i] this time around there are three (!) different pets that will accompany you throughout your travels and aid you when they can.

Nice variation in puzzles, beautiful locations, good story, fun pets, and improved voice acting (albeit still poor at times).

Encountered no bugs or broken achievements.
An Expert Mode run-through is required to get 100%.

[b]9/10[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198092065417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1428029761}
review:
Another decent hidden object game from Artifex Mundi.  Standard puzzles, nothing really new aside from maybe the pearl puzzle.  Voice acting is good aside from the children.  Roughly four hours of gameplay including the "extra" adventure.  Story is moderately interesting.  Perhaps it is worth noting that although it is the second game in the "Grim Legends" series, there is zero relation between the first and second games' stories.

Is it worth $10?  Depends on your valuation.  There's really not much replayability here unless you're a completionist.  The story isn't THAT good.  You'll get a bunch of achievements fairly easily though, if you're into that sort of thing.  I'd grab it on sale, at least 50% off.

Also, the noise from the forest spirits makes me want to destroy their entire race.

review: Personalmente, he jugado en una dificultad sencilla, y me ha resultado una historia interesante y sencilla, as√≠ como los puzles; sencilla, pero no lo suficiente como para llegar a ser aburrida. La considero bastante entretenida, sobre todo para personas a las que les gusten juegos tranquilos pero no demasiado largos, adem√°s de con una historia establecida por la que se va llevando al jugador/a. Por otro lado, lo recomendar√≠a quiz√° a los m√°s j√≥venes, obviamente dependiendo del gusto de cada uno, dado que en mi caso me agradan los puzles y juegos cortos, que guardan en cualquier momento y que puedes retomar en diez o veinte minutos libres sin problemas, pues podr√°s continuar la historia (vives escenas y encuentras objetos fundamentales, o puedes resolver uno o dos puzles en poco tiempo). Otro detalle que encuentro atractivo es que el juego cuenta con la posibilidad de adquirir logros, no solo en la plataforma de steam, sino en el propio juego. Las personas que disfrutan consiguiendo logros o trasteando con cromos se ver√°n envueltos en 29 sencillos y divertidos logros, y contar√°n con seis cromos coleccionables.
