author: {'steamid': '76561198086358045', 'num_games_owned': 1381, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1427686455}
review:
The Grim Legends series has got to be my favorite from Artifex Mundi. This is the second chapter, but it has a completely different story line from the original game, The Forsaken Bride. Since the stories are completely unrelated, you do not have to play the first game to understand this one. Despite its differences, I think that the biggest similarity is the captivating fairytale-like scenery. The visuals are jaw-dropping, leaving you eager for more.

As for the plot, you play as a famous healer, called by the King of the Eagle Kingdom to examine the Queen‚Äôs odd disease, which prevents her from speaking. During your preparations to cure the Queen, a strange beam of dark magic engulfs the Queen‚Äôs chambers, leaving the Queen unconscious on the floor while her son, the Prince, is nowhere to be found. The Queen is found guilty of practicing dark magic; thus, she is sentenced to death. The King is devastated to hear the news but he believes that his wife is innocent. He asks you to embark on a quest to find out what truly happened, and so your adventure awaits‚Ä¶

The puzzles can be quite challenging at times but most of them are easy to accomplish, especially if you are an experienced hidden object fan. Unlike the first game, this one does not have the domino mini-game as an alternative to finding objects. Some features of this game include three adorable pets that help you in your journey and a bonus adventure told in two viewpoints.

Overall, I loved this game! I absolutely recommend it if you are a fan of hidden objects or if you are interested in casual point and click adventures with beautiful artwork. I cannot wait for Grim Legends 3!

author: {'steamid': '76561198105646429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 506, 'last_played': 1438498790}
review:
I was really impressed by this game. It has a real intense story, with even some twists, while at the same time providing a lot of mini games and puzzles. The puzzels mostly fit nicely into the story, which is quite seldom the case. The minigames are varying quite nicely. Beside of some of the hidden object minigames, none is the same as another (sometimes there is more than one of the same time in a sequence). Even the hidden object minigames are varying, which is really great.

But the element that really keeps one to continue this game is how everything is driven by the story.  The story is provided with small cutscenes and short dialoges. But also by some of the minigames or other things one just discoveres. All those scenes are short enough, so that I never was tempted to skip them. (You get an archivement for not skipping the first ones.)

Last but not least I liked both the graphic and the music. Both added to the atmosphere of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008761840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1427552652}
review:
Czarny ≈Åabƒôd≈∫ to moja 13-ta gra od Artifex Mundi uko≈Ñczona, tak jak pozosta≈Çe, na 100% i stawiam jƒÖ na r√≥wni z Pie≈õniƒÖ Syreny, kt√≥ra do tej pory by≈Ça wed≈Çug mnie najlepszƒÖ grƒÖ AM dostƒôpnƒÖ na steam. Wizualnie gra wypada bardzo dobrze - lokacje sprawiajƒÖ wra≈ºenie rƒôcznie rysowanych w bajkowej kolorystyce. W pierwszej czƒô≈õci Grim legends towarzyszy≈Ço nam jedno zwierzƒÖtko - tutaj jest ich ca≈Ça tr√≥jka istotek z czego ta ostatnia wydaje mi siƒô najsympatyczniejszƒÖ z wszystkich pojawiajƒÖcych siƒô w grach AM. Poziom trudno≈õci gry i d≈Çugo≈õƒá rozgrywki jest standardowy dla wiƒôkszo≈õci gier AM. Czarny ≈Åabƒôd≈∫ ma zdecydowanie mniej standardowych(szukania przedmiot√≥w po ich napisach - a te dostƒôpne sƒÖ bardzo proste) gier w ukryte przedmioty ni≈º inne pozycje tej firmy. Przewa≈ºajƒÖ tutaj wyszukiwania okre≈õlonej ilo≈õci tych samych przedmiot√≥w na jednym obrazku. W GL2 nie ma gry wymiennej dla poszukiwania ukrytych przedmiot√≥w. Poszukujemy r√≥wnie≈º pieczƒôci w lokacjach posi≈ÇkujƒÖc siƒô niczym radarem, jak w pierwszym Grim Legends, wskazaniami interfejsu.
Czekamy na trzeciƒÖ czƒô≈õƒá. Gra w dniu premiery na steam kosztuje 20 z≈Ç czyli trzykrotnie mniej ni≈º obecnie DLC do gry pewnej japo≈Ñskiej firmy wydane kilka lat temu na konsolach.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043517958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1427937551}
review:
Just when I thought it would never happen, just when I had given up hope, just when I had realized I would be aimlessly banging rocks together for the rest of my puzzle-gaming career, I combined flint and steel to make a fire.

Also there was a nifty puzzle game and stuff.

This is no mere clone of the first game. The tone is darker, with much more death; there's no single cute helper; the familiar "find the object OR play the game" is swapped out for smaller hunts. The music isn't quite as atmospheric and the sense of mystery and discovery is swapped out for, well, an actual mystery you  have to solve. Having to meet more people and talk to them changes the sense of isolation and exploration from the first game. There's less exploring a new world and more unraveling the past. Is it better? Depends on what you want. 

Also I have to say it: that face in the one hidden object game came off as a little, um. Racist?

author: {'steamid': '76561197995498874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1427411404}
review:
Here's a beautiful light point & click adventure game from Artifex Mundi, and it might be their best yet. The game is based on the popular fairy tale "The Wild Swans" by Handersen, and features gorgeous backgrounds, beautiful music and an engaging story, as well as excellent voice acting. As a bonus, you'll get companions like a bird, a fairy and a cute otter :3

Even though it's part of the "Grim Legends" series, it works as a stand alone game so you don't really need to play the first one (which is a pleasant game too). 

I definitely recommend it if you're looking for a relaxing, cozy adventure game

8/10
